Theory Basics

section ‚ÄπBasic Results‚Ä∫

theory Basics
imports
  HOL.Set_Interval
  HOL.Semiring_Normalization
  HOL.Real_Vector_Spaces
  HOL.Power
  HOL.Complex
  Jordan_Normal_Form.Jordan_Normal_Form
begin



subsection ‚ÄπBasic Set-Theoretic Results‚Ä∫

lemma set_2_atLeast0 [simp]: "{0..<2::nat} = {0,1}" by auto

lemma set_2: "{..<2::nat} = {0,1}" by auto

lemma set_4_atLeast0 [simp]:"{0..<4::nat} = {0,1,2,3}" by auto

lemma set_4: "{..<4::nat} = {0,1,2,3}" by auto

lemma set_4_disj [simp]: 
  fixes i:: nat
  assumes "i < 4"
  shows "i = 0 ‚à® i = 1 ‚à® i = 2 ‚à® i = 3" 
  using assms by auto

lemma set_8_atLeast0 [simp]: "{0..<8::nat} = {0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7}" by auto

lemma index_is_2 [simp]: "‚àÄi::nat. i ‚â† Suc 0 ‚ü∂ i ‚â† 3 ‚ü∂ 0 < i ‚ü∂ i < 4 ‚ü∂ i = 2" by simp

lemma index_sl_four [simp]: "‚àÄi::nat. i < 4 ‚ü∂ i = 0 ‚à® i = 1 ‚à® i = 2 ‚à® i = 3" by auto


subsection ‚ÄπBasic Arithmetic Results‚Ä∫

lemma index_div_eq [simp]:
  fixes i::nat
  shows "i‚àà{a*b..<(a+1)*b} ‚üπ i div b = a"
proof-
  fix i::nat 
  assume a:"i‚àà{a*b..<(a+1)*b}"
  then have "i div b ‚â• a"
    by (metis Suc_eq_plus1 atLeastLessThan_iff le_refl semiring_normalization_rules(7) split_div')
  moreover have "i div b < a+1"
    using a by (simp add: less_mult_imp_div_less)
  ultimately show "i div b = a" by simp
qed

lemma index_mod_eq [simp]:
  fixes i::nat
  shows "i‚àà{a*b..<(a+1)*b} ‚üπ i mod b = i-a*b"
  by (simp add: modulo_nat_def)

lemma sqr_of_cmod_of_prod:
  shows "(cmod (z1 * z2))‚áß2 = (cmod z1)‚áß2 * (cmod z2)‚áß2"
  by (simp add: norm_mult power_mult_distrib)

lemma less_power_add_imp_div_less [simp]:
  fixes i m n:: nat
  assumes "i < 2^(m+n)"
  shows "i div 2^n < 2^m"
  using assms by (simp add: less_mult_imp_div_less power_add)

lemma div_mult_mod_eq_minus:
  fixes i j:: nat
  shows "(i div 2^n) * 2^n + i mod 2^n - (j div 2^n) * 2^n - j mod 2^n = i - j"
  by (simp add: div_mult_mod_eq algebra_simps)

lemma neq_imp_neq_div_or_mod:
  fixes i j:: nat
  assumes "i ‚â† j"
  shows "i div 2^n ‚â† j div 2^n ‚à® i mod 2^n ‚â† j mod 2^n"
  using assms div_mult_mod_eq_minus
  by (metis add.right_neutral cancel_div_mod_rules(2))
  
lemma index_one_mat_div_mod:
  assumes "i < 2^(m+n)" and "j < 2^(m+n)"
  shows "((1‚á©m(2^m) $$ (i div 2^n, j div 2^n))::complex) * 1‚á©m(2^n) $$ (i mod 2^n, j mod 2^n) = 1‚á©m(2^(m+n)) $$ (i, j)"
proof (cases "i = j")
  case True
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: assms)
next
  case c1:False
  have "i div 2^n ‚â† j div 2^n ‚à® i mod 2^n ‚â† j mod 2^n"
    using c1 neq_imp_neq_div_or_mod by simp 
  then have "1‚á©m (2^m) $$ (i div 2^n, j div 2^n) = 0 ‚à® 1‚á©m (2^n) $$ (i mod 2^n, j mod 2^n) = 0"
    using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis
    using assms by (simp add: c1)
qed

lemma sqr_of_sqrt_2 [simp]:
  fixes z:: "complex"
  shows "z * 2 / (complex_of_real (sqrt 2) * complex_of_real (sqrt 2)) = z"
  by(metis nonzero_mult_div_cancel_right norm_numeral of_real_numeral of_real_power power2_eq_square 
real_norm_def real_sqrt_abs real_sqrt_power zero_neq_numeral)

lemma two_div_sqrt_two [simp]:
  shows "2 * complex_of_real (sqrt (1/2)) = complex_of_real (sqrt 2)"
    apply(auto simp add: real_sqrt_divide algebra_simps)
    by (metis divide_eq_0_iff nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left sqr_of_sqrt_2)

lemma two_div_sqr_of_cmd_sqrt_two [simp]: 
  shows "2 * (cmod (1 / complex_of_real (sqrt 2)))‚áß2 = 1" 
  using cmod_def by (simp add: power_divide)

lemma two_div_two [simp]: 
  shows "2 div Suc (Suc 0) = 1" by simp

lemma two_mod_two [simp]: 
  shows "2 mod Suc (Suc 0) = 0" by (simp add: numeral_2_eq_2)

lemma three_div_two [simp]: 
  shows "3 div Suc (Suc 0) = 1" by (simp add: numeral_3_eq_3)

lemma three_mod_two [simp]: 
  shows "3 mod Suc (Suc 0) = 1" by (simp add: mod_Suc numeral_3_eq_3)


subsection ‚ÄπBasic Results on Matrices‚Ä∫

lemma index_matrix_prod [simp]:
  assumes "i < dim_row A" and "j < dim_col B" and "dim_col A = dim_row B"
  shows "(A * B) $$ (i,j) = (‚àëk<dim_row B. (A $$ (i,k)) * (B $$ (k,j)))"
  using assms 
    apply(simp add: scalar_prod_def atLeast0LessThan).


subsection ‚ÄπBasic Results on Sums‚Ä∫

lemma sum_insert [simp]:
  assumes "x ‚àâ F" and "finite F"
  shows "(‚àëy‚ààinsert x F. P y) = (‚àëy‚ààF. P y) + P x"
  using assms insert_def by(simp add: add.commute)

lemma sum_of_index_diff [simp]:
  fixes f:: "nat ‚áí 'a::comm_monoid_add"
  shows "(‚àëi‚àà{a..<a+b}. f(i-a)) = (‚àëi‚àà{..<b}. f(i))"
proof (induction b)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc b)
  then show ?case by simp
qed


subsection ‚ÄπBasic Results Involving the Exponential Function.‚Ä∫

lemma exp_of_real_cnj:
  fixes x ::real
  shows "cnj (exp (ùóÇ * x)) = exp (-(ùóÇ * x))"
proof
  show "Re (cnj (exp (ùóÇ * x))) = Re (exp (-(ùóÇ * x)))"
    using Re_exp by simp
  show "Im (cnj (exp (ùóÇ * x))) = Im (exp (-(ùóÇ * x)))"
    using Im_exp by simp
qed

lemma exp_of_real_cnj2:
  fixes x ::real
  shows "cnj (exp (-(ùóÇ * x))) = exp (ùóÇ * x)"
proof
  show "Re (cnj (exp (-(ùóÇ * x)))) = Re (exp (ùóÇ * x))"
    using Re_exp by simp
  show "Im (cnj (exp (-(ùóÇ * x)))) = Im (exp (ùóÇ * x))"
    using Im_exp by simp
qed

lemma exp_of_half_pi: 
  fixes x:: real
  assumes "x = pi/2"
  shows "exp (ùóÇ * complex_of_real x) = ùóÇ"
  using assms cis_conv_exp cis_pi_half by fastforce

lemma exp_of_minus_half_pi: 
  fixes x:: real
  assumes "x = pi/2"
  shows "exp (-(ùóÇ * complex_of_real x)) = -ùóÇ"
  using assms cis_conv_exp cis_minus_pi_half by fastforce

lemma exp_of_real:
  fixes x:: real
  shows "exp (ùóÇ * x) = cos x + ùóÇ * (sin x)"
proof
  show "Re (exp (ùóÇ * x)) = Re ((cos x) + ùóÇ * (sin x))"
    using Re_exp by simp
  show "Im (exp (ùóÇ * x)) = Im ((cos x) + ùóÇ * (sin x))"
    using Im_exp by simp
qed

lemma exp_of_real_inv:
  fixes x:: real
  shows "exp (-(ùóÇ * x)) = cos x - ùóÇ * (sin x)"
proof
  show "Re (exp (-(ùóÇ * x))) = Re ((cos x) - ùóÇ * (sin x))"
    using Re_exp by simp
  show "Im (exp (-(ùóÇ * x))) = Im ((cos x) - ùóÇ * (sin x))"
    using Im_exp by simp
qed


subsection ‚ÄπBasic Results with Trigonometric Functions.‚Ä∫

subsubsection ‚ÄπBasic Inequalities‚Ä∫

lemma sin_squared_le_one:
  fixes x:: real
  shows "(sin x)‚áß2 ‚â§ 1"
  using abs_sin_le_one abs_square_le_1 by blast

lemma cos_squared_le_one:
  fixes x:: real
  shows "(cos x)‚áß2 ‚â§ 1"
  using abs_cos_le_one abs_square_le_1 by blast

subsubsection ‚ÄπBasic Equalities‚Ä∫

lemma sin_of_quarter_pi:
  fixes x:: real
  assumes "x = pi/2"
  shows "sin (x/2) = (sqrt 2)/2"
  by (auto simp add: assms sin_45)

lemma cos_of_quarter_pi:
  fixes x:: real
  assumes "x = pi/2"
  shows "cos (x/2) = (sqrt 2)/2"
  by (auto simp add: assms cos_45)

end

Theory Binary_Nat

(* 
Authors: 
  Anthony Bordg, University of Cambridge, apdb3@cam.ac.uk 
  Hanna Lachnitt, TU Wien, lachnitt@student.tuwien.ac.at
*)

section ‚ÄπBinary Representation of Natural Numbers‚Ä∫

theory Binary_Nat
imports
  HOL.Nat
  HOL.List
  Basics
begin 


primrec bin_rep_aux:: "nat ‚áí nat ‚áí nat list" where
  "bin_rep_aux 0 m = [m]"
| "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m = m div 2^n # bin_rep_aux n (m mod 2^n)"

lemma length_of_bin_rep_aux:
  fixes n m:: nat
  assumes "m < 2^n"
  shows "length (bin_rep_aux n m) = n+1" 
  using assms
proof(induction n arbitrary: m)
  case 0
  then show "length (bin_rep_aux 0 m) = 0 + 1" by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  assume a0:"‚ãÄm. m < 2^n ‚üπ length (bin_rep_aux n m) = n + 1" and "m < 2^(Suc n)"
  then show "length (bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m) = Suc n + 1" 
    using a0 by simp
qed

lemma bin_rep_aux_neq_nil:
  fixes n m:: nat
  shows "bin_rep_aux n m ‚â† []" 
  using bin_rep_aux.simps by (metis list.distinct(1) old.nat.exhaust)

lemma last_of_bin_rep_aux:
  fixes n m:: nat 
  assumes "m < 2^n" and "m ‚â• 0"
  shows "last (bin_rep_aux n m) = 0"
  using assms
proof(induction n arbitrary: m)
  case 0
  assume "m < 2^0" and "m ‚â• 0"
  then show "last (bin_rep_aux 0 m) = 0" by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  assume a0:"‚ãÄm. m < 2^n ‚üπ m ‚â• 0 ‚üπ last (bin_rep_aux n m) = 0" and "m < 2^(Suc n)"
and "m ‚â• 0"
  then show "last (bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m) = 0" 
    using bin_rep_aux_neq_nil by simp
qed

lemma mod_mod_power_cancel:
  fixes m n p:: nat
  assumes "m ‚â§ n"
  shows "p mod 2^n mod 2^m = p mod 2^m" 
  using assms by (simp add: dvd_power_le mod_mod_cancel)
    
lemma bin_rep_aux_index:
  fixes n m i:: nat
  assumes "n ‚â• 1" and "m < 2^n" and "m ‚â• 0" and "i ‚â§ n"
  shows "bin_rep_aux n m ! i = (m mod 2^(n-i)) div 2^(n-1-i)"
  using assms
proof(induction n arbitrary: m i rule: nat_induct_at_least)
  case base
  assume "m < 2^1" and "i ‚â§ 1"
  then show "bin_rep_aux 1 m ! i = m mod 2^(1-i) div 2^(1-1-i)" 
    using bin_rep_aux.simps
    by (metis One_nat_def base.prems(2) diff_is_0_eq' diff_zero div_by_1 le_Suc_eq le_numeral_extra(3) 
nth_Cons' power_0 unique_euclidean_semiring_numeral_class.mod_less)
next
  case (Suc n)
  assume a0:"‚ãÄm i. m < 2^n ‚üπ m ‚â• 0 ‚üπ i ‚â§ n ‚üπ bin_rep_aux n m ! i = m mod 2 ^ (n-i) div 2^(n-1-i)"
and a1:"m < 2^(Suc n)" and a2:"i ‚â§ Suc n" and a3:"m ‚â• 0"
  then show "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = m mod 2^(Suc n - i) div 2^(Suc n - 1 - i)"
  proof-
    have "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m = m div 2^n # bin_rep_aux n (m mod 2^n)" by simp
    then have f0:"bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = (m div 2^n # bin_rep_aux n (m mod 2^n)) ! i" by simp
    then have "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = m div 2^n" if "i = 0" using that by simp
    then have f1:"bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = m mod 2^(Suc n - i) div 2^(Suc n - 1 - i)" if "i = 0"
    proof-
      have "m mod 2^(Suc n - i) = m" 
        using that a1 by (simp add: Suc.prems(2))
      then have "m mod 2^(Suc n - i) div 2^(Suc n - 1 - i) = m div 2^n" 
        using that by simp
      thus ?thesis by (simp add: that)
    qed
    then have "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = bin_rep_aux n (m mod 2^n) ! (i-1)" if "i ‚â• 1"
      using that f0 by simp
    then have f2:"bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = ((m mod 2^n) mod 2^(n - (i - 1))) div 2^(n - 1 - (i - 1))" if "i ‚â• 1"
      using that a0 a1 a2 a3 Suc.prems(2) by simp
    then have f3:"bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = ((m mod 2^n) mod 2^(Suc n - i)) div 2^(Suc n - 1 - i)" if "i ‚â• 1"
      using that by simp
    then have "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = m mod 2^(Suc n - i) div 2^(Suc n - 1 - i)" if "i ‚â• 1" 
    proof-
      have "Suc n - i ‚â§ n" using that by simp
      then have "m mod 2^n mod 2^(Suc n - i) = m mod 2^(Suc n - i)" 
        using mod_mod_power_cancel[of "Suc n - i" "n" "m"] by simp
      thus ?thesis 
        using that f3 by simp
    qed
    thus ?thesis using f1 f2
      using linorder_not_less by blast
  qed
qed

lemma bin_rep_aux_coeff:
  fixes n m i:: nat
  assumes "m < 2^n" and "i ‚â§ n" and "m ‚â• 0"
  shows "bin_rep_aux n m ! i = 0 ‚à® bin_rep_aux n m ! i = 1"
  using assms
proof(induction n arbitrary: m i)
  case 0
  assume "m < 2^0" and "i ‚â§ 0" and "m ‚â• 0"
  then show "bin_rep_aux 0 m ! i = 0 ‚à® bin_rep_aux 0 m ! i = 1" by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  assume a0:"‚ãÄm i. m < 2 ^ n ‚üπ i ‚â§ n ‚üπ m ‚â• 0 ‚üπ bin_rep_aux n m ! i = 0 ‚à® bin_rep_aux n m ! i = 1" 
and a1:"m < 2^Suc n" and a2:"i ‚â§ Suc n" and a3:"m ‚â• 0"
  then show "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = 0 ‚à® bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = 1"
  proof-
    have "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = (m div 2^n # bin_rep_aux n (m mod 2^n)) ! i" by simp
    moreover have "‚Ä¶ = bin_rep_aux n (m mod 2^n) ! (i - 1)" if "i ‚â• 1"
      using that by simp
    moreover have "m mod 2^n < 2^n" by simp
    ultimately have "bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = 0 ‚à® bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m ! i = 1" if "i‚â•1"
      using that a0[of "m mod 2^n" "i-1"] a2 by simp
    moreover have "m div 2^n = 0 ‚à® m div 2^n = 1" 
      using a1 a3 less_mult_imp_div_less by(simp add: less_2_cases)
    ultimately show ?thesis by (simp add: nth_Cons')
  qed
qed

definition bin_rep:: "nat ‚áí nat ‚áí nat list" where
"bin_rep n m = butlast (bin_rep_aux n m)"

lemma length_of_bin_rep:
  fixes n m:: nat
  assumes "m < 2^n"
  shows "length (bin_rep n m) = n"
  using assms length_of_bin_rep_aux bin_rep_def by simp

lemma bin_rep_coeff:
  fixes n m i:: nat
  assumes "m < 2^n" and "i < n" and "m ‚â• 0"
  shows "bin_rep n m ! i = 0 ‚à® bin_rep n m ! i = 1" 
  using assms bin_rep_def bin_rep_aux_coeff length_of_bin_rep by(simp add: nth_butlast)

lemma bin_rep_index:
  fixes n m i:: nat
  assumes "n ‚â• 1" and "m < 2^n" and "i < n" and "m ‚â• 0"
  shows "bin_rep n m ! i = (m mod 2^(n-i)) div 2^(n-1-i)"
proof-
  have "bin_rep n m ! i = bin_rep_aux n m ! i"
    using bin_rep_def length_of_bin_rep nth_butlast assms(3)
    by (simp add: nth_butlast assms(2))
  thus ?thesis
    using assms bin_rep_aux_index by simp
qed

lemma bin_rep_eq:
  fixes n m:: nat 
  assumes "n ‚â• 1" and "m ‚â• 0" and "m < 2^n" and "m ‚â• 0"
  shows "m = (‚àëi<n. bin_rep n m ! i * 2^(n-1-i))"
proof-
  {
    fix i:: nat
    assume "i < n"
    then have "bin_rep n m ! i * 2^(n-1-i) = (m mod 2^(n-i)) div 2^(n-1-i) * 2^(n-1-i)"
      using assms bin_rep_index by simp
    moreover have "‚Ä¶ = m mod 2^(n-i) - m mod 2^(n-i) mod 2^(n-1-i)"
      by (simp add: minus_mod_eq_div_mult)
    moreover have "‚Ä¶ = int(m mod 2^(n-i)) - m mod 2^(n-i) mod 2^(n-1-i)" 
      using mod_less_eq_dividend of_nat_diff by blast
    moreover have "‚Ä¶ = int(m mod 2^(n-i)) - m mod 2^(n-1-i)" 
      using mod_mod_power_cancel[of "n-1-i" "n-i"] by (simp add: dvd_power_le mod_mod_cancel)
    ultimately have "bin_rep n m ! i * 2^(n-1-i) = int (m mod 2^(n-i)) - m mod 2^(n-1-i)" 
      by presburger
  }
  then have f0:"(‚àëi<n. bin_rep n m ! i * 2^(n-1-i)) = (‚àëi<n. int (m mod 2^(n-i)) - m mod 2^(n-1-i))" 
    by auto
  thus ?thesis
  proof-
     have "(‚àëi<n. int ((m::nat) mod 2^(n - i)) - (m mod 2^(n - 1 - i))) = 
          (‚àëi<n. ( m mod 2^(n - i))) -  (‚àëi<n. int (m mod 2^(n - 1 - i)))" 
      using sum_subtractf[of "(Œªi. (m mod 2^(n-i)))::nat‚áínat" "(Œªi. (m mod 2^(n-1-i)))::nat‚áínat" "{..<(n::nat)}"] 
      by auto
    moreover have "‚Ä¶ = m mod 2^n + (‚àëi‚àà{1..<n}. (m mod 2^(n-i))) - (‚àëi<n-1. int (m mod 2^(n-1-i)))- m mod 2^0" 
      using sum.atLeast_Suc_atMost sum.lessThan_Suc assms(1) 
      by (smt One_nat_def Suc_le_eq diff_self_eq_0 le_add_diff_inverse lessThan_atLeast0 minus_nat.diff_0 
          plus_1_eq_Suc sum.atLeast_Suc_lessThan)
    moreover have "‚Ä¶ = m mod 2^n + (‚àëi<n-1. m mod 2^(n-i-1)) - (‚àëi<n-1. int ( m mod 2^(n-1-i))) - m mod 2^0" 
      apply (auto simp add: sum_of_index_diff[of "Œªi. m mod 2 ^ (n - 1 - i)" "1" "n-1"])
      by (smt One_nat_def assms(1) le_add_diff_inverse lessThan_atLeast0 plus_1_eq_Suc sum.cong sum.shift_bounds_Suc_ivl)
    moreover have "‚Ä¶ = m mod 2^n - m mod 2^0" by simp
    moreover have "‚Ä¶ = m" using assms by auto
    ultimately show "m = (‚àëi<n. bin_rep n m ! i * 2^(n-1-i))"
      using assms f0 by linarith
  qed
qed

lemma bin_rep_index_0:
  fixes n m:: nat
  assumes "m < 2^n" and "k > n"
  shows "(bin_rep k m) ! 0 = 0"
proof-
  have "m < 2^(k-1)" 
    using assms by(smt Suc_diff_1 Suc_leI gr0I le_trans less_or_eq_imp_le linorder_neqE_nat not_less 
one_less_numeral_iff power_strict_increasing semiring_norm(76))
  then have f:"m div 2^(k-1) = 0" 
    by auto
  have "k ‚â• 1" 
    using assms(2) by simp
  moreover have "bin_rep_aux k m = (m div 2^(k-1)) # (bin_rep_aux (k-1) (m mod 2^(k-1)))"
    using bin_rep_aux.simps(2) by(metis Suc_diff_1 assms(2) diff_0_eq_0 neq0_conv zero_less_diff)
  moreover have "bin_rep k m = butlast ((m div 2^(k-1)) # (bin_rep_aux (k-1) (m mod 2^(k-1))))" 
    using bin_rep_def by (simp add: calculation(2))
  moreover have "‚Ä¶ = butlast (0 # (bin_rep_aux (k-1) (m mod 2^(k-1))))" 
    using f by simp
  moreover have "‚Ä¶ = 0 # butlast (bin_rep_aux (k-1) (m mod 2^(k-1)))" 
    by(simp add: bin_rep_aux_neq_nil)
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

lemma bin_rep_index_0_geq:
  fixes n m:: nat
  assumes "m ‚â• 2^n" and "m < 2^(n+1)"
  shows "bin_rep (n+1) m ! 0 = 1"
proof-
  have "bin_rep (Suc n) m =  butlast (bin_rep_aux (Suc n) m)" 
    using bin_rep_def by simp
  moreover have "‚Ä¶ = butlast (1 # (bin_rep_aux n (m mod 2^n)))" 
    using assms bin_rep_aux_def by simp
  moreover have "‚Ä¶ = 1 # butlast (bin_rep_aux n (m mod 2^n))"
    by (simp add: bin_rep_aux_neq_nil)
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by (simp add: bin_rep_aux_neq_nil)
qed

end

Theory Quantum

(*
Authors: 

  Anthony Bordg, University of Cambridge, apdb3@cam.ac.uk
  Yijun He, University of Cambridge, yh403@cam.ac.uk
  with contributions by Hanna Lachnitt
*)

section ‚ÄπQubits and Quantum Gates‚Ä∫

theory Quantum
imports
  Jordan_Normal_Form.Matrix
  "HOL-Library.Nonpos_Ints"
  Basics
  Binary_Nat
begin


subsection ‚ÄπQubits‚Ä∫

text‚ÄπIn this theory @{text cpx} stands for @{text complex}.‚Ä∫

definition cpx_vec_length :: "complex vec ‚áí real" ("‚à•_‚à•") where
"cpx_vec_length v ‚â° sqrt(‚àëi<dim_vec v. (cmod (v $ i))‚áß2)"

lemma cpx_length_of_vec_of_list [simp]:
  "‚à•vec_of_list l‚à• = sqrt(‚àëi<length l. (cmod (l ! i))‚áß2)"
  by (auto simp: cpx_vec_length_def vec_of_list_def vec_of_list_index)
    (metis (no_types, lifting) dim_vec_of_list sum.cong vec_of_list.abs_eq vec_of_list_index)

lemma norm_vec_index_unit_vec_is_0 [simp]:
  assumes "j < n" and "j ‚â† i"
  shows "cmod ((unit_vec n i) $ j) = 0"
  using assms by (simp add: unit_vec_def)

lemma norm_vec_index_unit_vec_is_1 [simp]:
  assumes "j < n" and "j = i"
  shows "cmod ((unit_vec n i) $ j) = 1"
proof -
  have f:"(unit_vec n i) $ j = 1"
    using assms by simp
  thus ?thesis
    by (simp add: f cmod_def) 
qed

lemma unit_cpx_vec_length [simp]:
  assumes "i < n"
  shows "‚à•unit_vec n i‚à• = 1"
proof -
  have "(‚àëj<n. (cmod((unit_vec n i) $ j))‚áß2) = (‚àëj<n. if j = i then 1 else 0)"
    using norm_vec_index_unit_vec_is_0 norm_vec_index_unit_vec_is_1
    by (smt lessThan_iff one_power2 sum.cong zero_power2) 
  also have "‚Ä¶ = 1"
    using assms by simp
  finally have "sqrt (‚àëj<n. (cmod((unit_vec n i) $ j))‚áß2) = 1" 
    by simp
  thus ?thesis
    using cpx_vec_length_def by simp
qed

lemma smult_vec_length [simp]:
  assumes "x ‚â• 0"
  shows "‚à•complex_of_real(x) ‚ãÖ‚á©v v‚à• = x * ‚à•v‚à•"
proof-
  have "(Œªi::nat.(cmod (complex_of_real x * v $ i))‚áß2) = (Œªi::nat. (cmod (v $ i))‚áß2 * x‚áß2)" 
    by (auto simp: norm_mult power_mult_distrib)
  then have "(‚àëi<dim_vec v. (cmod (complex_of_real x * v $ i))‚áß2) = 
             (‚àëi<dim_vec v. (cmod (v $ i))‚áß2 * x‚áß2)" by meson
  moreover have "(‚àëi<dim_vec v. (cmod (v $ i))‚áß2 * x‚áß2) = x‚áß2 * (‚àëi<dim_vec v. (cmod (v $ i))‚áß2)"
    by (metis (no_types) mult.commute sum_distrib_right)
  moreover have "sqrt(x‚áß2 * (‚àëi<dim_vec v. (cmod (v $ i))‚áß2)) = 
                 sqrt(x‚áß2) * sqrt (‚àëi<dim_vec v. (cmod (v $ i))‚áß2)" 
    using real_sqrt_mult by blast
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by(simp add: cpx_vec_length_def assms)
qed

locale state =
  fixes n:: nat and v:: "complex mat"
  assumes is_column [simp]: "dim_col v = 1"
    and dim_row [simp]: "dim_row v = 2^n"
    and is_normal [simp]: "‚à•col v 0‚à• = 1"

text‚Äπ 
Below the natural number n codes for the dimension of the complex vector space whose elements of norm
1 we call states. 
‚Ä∫

lemma unit_vec_of_right_length_is_state [simp]:
  assumes "i < 2^n"
  shows "unit_vec (2^n) i ‚àà {v| n v::complex vec. dim_vec v = 2^n ‚àß ‚à•v‚à• = 1}"
proof-
  have "dim_vec (unit_vec (2^n) i) = 2^n" 
    by simp
  moreover have "‚à•unit_vec (2^n) i‚à• = 1"
    using assms by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

definition state_qbit :: "nat ‚áí complex vec set" where
"state_qbit n ‚â° {v| v:: complex vec. dim_vec v = 2^n ‚àß ‚à•v‚à• = 1}"

lemma (in state) state_to_state_qbit [simp]:
  shows "col v 0 ‚àà state_qbit n"
  using state_def state_qbit_def by simp

subsection "The Hermitian Conjugation"

text ‚ÄπThe Hermitian conjugate of a complex matrix is the complex conjugate of its transpose. ‚Ä∫

definition dagger :: "complex mat ‚áí complex mat" ("_‚áß‚Ä†") where
  "M‚áß‚Ä† ‚â° mat (dim_col M) (dim_row M) (Œª(i,j). cnj(M $$ (j,i)))"

text ‚ÄπWe introduce the type of complex square matrices.‚Ä∫

typedef cpx_sqr_mat = "{M | M::complex mat. square_mat M}"
proof-
  have "square_mat (1‚á©m n)" for n
    using one_mat_def by simp
  thus ?thesis by blast
qed

definition cpx_sqr_mat_to_cpx_mat :: "cpx_sqr_mat => complex mat" where
"cpx_sqr_mat_to_cpx_mat M ‚â° Rep_cpx_sqr_mat M"

text ‚Äπ
We introduce a coercion from the type of complex square matrices to the type of complex 
matrices.
‚Ä∫

declare [[coercion cpx_sqr_mat_to_cpx_mat]]

lemma dim_row_of_dagger [simp]:
  "dim_row (M‚áß‚Ä†) = dim_col M"
  using dagger_def by simp

lemma dim_col_of_dagger [simp]:
  "dim_col (M‚áß‚Ä†) = dim_row M"
  using dagger_def by simp

lemma col_of_dagger [simp]:
  assumes "j < dim_row M"
  shows "col (M‚áß‚Ä†) j = vec (dim_col M) (Œªi. cnj (M $$ (j,i)))"
  using assms col_def dagger_def by simp

lemma row_of_dagger [simp]:
  assumes "i < dim_col M"
  shows "row (M‚áß‚Ä†) i = vec (dim_row M) (Œªj. cnj (M $$ (j,i)))"
  using assms row_def dagger_def by simp

lemma dagger_of_dagger_is_id:
  fixes M :: "complex Matrix.mat"
  shows "(M‚áß‚Ä†)‚áß‚Ä† = M"
proof
  show "dim_row ((M‚áß‚Ä†)‚áß‚Ä†) = dim_row M" by simp
  show "dim_col ((M‚áß‚Ä†)‚áß‚Ä†) = dim_col M" by simp
  fix i j assume a0:"i < dim_row M" and a1:"j < dim_col M"
  then show "(M‚áß‚Ä†)‚áß‚Ä† $$ (i,j) = M $$ (i,j)"
  proof-
    show ?thesis
      using dagger_def a0 a1 by auto
  qed
qed

lemma dagger_of_sqr_is_sqr [simp]:
  "square_mat ((M::cpx_sqr_mat)‚áß‚Ä†)"
proof-
  have "square_mat M"
    using cpx_sqr_mat_to_cpx_mat_def Rep_cpx_sqr_mat by simp
  then have "dim_row M = dim_col M" by simp
  then have "dim_col (M‚áß‚Ä†) = dim_row (M‚áß‚Ä†)" by simp
  thus "square_mat (M‚áß‚Ä†)" by simp
qed

lemma dagger_of_id_is_id [simp]:
  "(1‚á©m n)‚áß‚Ä† = 1‚á©m n"
  using dagger_def one_mat_def by auto

subsection "Unitary Matrices and Quantum Gates"

definition unitary :: "complex mat ‚áí bool" where
"unitary M ‚â° (M‚áß‚Ä†) * M = 1‚á©m (dim_col M) ‚àß M * (M‚áß‚Ä†) = 1‚á©m (dim_row M)"

lemma id_is_unitary [simp]:
  "unitary (1‚á©m n)"
  by (simp add: unitary_def)

locale gate =
  fixes n:: nat and A:: "complex mat"
  assumes dim_row [simp]: "dim_row A = 2^n"
    and square_mat [simp]: "square_mat A"
    and unitary [simp]: "unitary A"

text ‚Äπ
We prove that a quantum gate is invertible and its inverse is given by its Hermitian conjugate.
‚Ä∫

lemma mat_unitary_mat [intro]:
  assumes "unitary M"
  shows "inverts_mat M (M‚áß‚Ä†)"
  using assms by (simp add: unitary_def inverts_mat_def)

lemma unitary_mat_mat [intro]:
  assumes "unitary M"
  shows "inverts_mat (M‚áß‚Ä†) M"
  using assms by (simp add: unitary_def inverts_mat_def)

lemma (in gate) gate_is_inv:
  "invertible_mat A"
  using square_mat unitary invertible_mat_def by blast

subsection "Relations Between Complex Conjugation, Hermitian Conjugation, Transposition and Unitarity"

notation transpose_mat ("(_‚áßt)")

lemma col_tranpose [simp]:
  assumes "dim_row M = n" and "i < n"
  shows "col (M‚áßt) i = row M i"
proof
  show "dim_vec (col (M‚áßt) i) = dim_vec (row M i)"
    by (simp add: row_def col_def transpose_mat_def)
next
  show "‚ãÄj. j < dim_vec (row M i) ‚üπ col M‚áßt i $ j = row M i $ j"
    using assms by (simp add: transpose_mat_def)
qed

lemma row_transpose [simp]:
  assumes "dim_col M = n" and "i < n"
  shows "row (M‚áßt) i = col M i"
  using assms by simp

definition cpx_mat_cnj :: "complex mat ‚áí complex mat" ("(_‚áß‚ãÜ)") where
"cpx_mat_cnj M ‚â° mat (dim_row M) (dim_col M) (Œª(i,j). cnj (M $$ (i,j)))"

lemma cpx_mat_cnj_id [simp]:
  "(1‚á©m n)‚áß‚ãÜ = 1‚á©m n" 
  by (auto simp: cpx_mat_cnj_def)

lemma cpx_mat_cnj_cnj [simp]:
  "(M‚áß‚ãÜ)‚áß‚ãÜ = M"
  by (auto simp: cpx_mat_cnj_def)

lemma dim_row_of_cjn_prod [simp]: 
  "dim_row ((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ)) = dim_row M"
  by (simp add: cpx_mat_cnj_def)

lemma dim_col_of_cjn_prod [simp]: 
  "dim_col ((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ)) = dim_col N"
  by (simp add: cpx_mat_cnj_def)

lemma cpx_mat_cnj_prod:
  assumes "dim_col M = dim_row N"
  shows "(M * N)‚áß‚ãÜ = (M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ)"
proof
  show "dim_row (M * N)‚áß‚ãÜ = dim_row ((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ))" 
    by (simp add: cpx_mat_cnj_def)
next
  show "dim_col ((M * N)‚áß‚ãÜ) = dim_col ((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ))" 
    by (simp add: cpx_mat_cnj_def)
next 
  fix i j::nat
  assume a1:"i < dim_row ((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ))" and a2:"j < dim_col ((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ))"
  then have "(M * N)‚áß‚ãÜ $$ (i,j) = cnj (‚àëk<(dim_row N). M $$ (i,k) * N $$ (k,j))"
    using assms cpx_mat_cnj_def index_mat times_mat_def scalar_prod_def row_def col_def 
dim_row_of_cjn_prod dim_col_of_cjn_prod
    by (smt case_prod_conv dim_col index_mult_mat(2) index_mult_mat(3) index_vec lessThan_atLeast0 
        lessThan_iff sum.cong)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àëk<(dim_row N). cnj(M $$ (i,k)) * cnj(N $$ (k,j)))" by simp
  also have "((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ)) $$ (i,j) = 
    (‚àëk<(dim_row N). cnj(M $$ (i,k)) * cnj(N $$ (k,j)))"
    using assms a1 a2 cpx_mat_cnj_def index_mat times_mat_def scalar_prod_def row_def col_def
    by (smt case_prod_conv dim_col dim_col_mat(1) dim_row_mat(1) index_vec lessThan_atLeast0 
        lessThan_iff sum.cong)
  finally show "(M * N)‚áß‚ãÜ $$ (i, j) = ((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ)) $$ (i, j)" by simp
qed

lemma transpose_of_prod:
  fixes M N::"complex Matrix.mat"
  assumes "dim_col M = dim_row N"
  shows "(M * N)‚áßt = N‚áßt * (M‚áßt)"
proof
  fix i j::nat
  assume a0: "i < dim_row (N‚áßt * (M‚áßt))" and a1: "j < dim_col (N‚áßt * (M‚áßt))"  
  then have "(M * N)‚áßt $$ (i,j) = (M * N) $$ (j,i)" by auto
  also have "... = (‚àëk<dim_row M‚áßt.  M $$ (j,k) * N $$ (k,i))"
    using assms a0 a1 by auto
  also have "... = (‚àëk<dim_row M‚áßt. N $$ (k,i) * M $$ (j,k))"
   by (simp add: semiring_normalization_rules(7))
  also have "... = (‚àëk<dim_row M‚áßt. ((N‚áßt) $$ (i,k)) * (M‚áßt) $$ (k,j))" 
    using assms a0 a1 by auto
  finally show "((M * N)‚áßt) $$ (i,j) = (N‚áßt * (M‚áßt)) $$ (i,j)" 
    using assms a0 a1 by auto
next
  show "dim_row ((M * N)‚áßt) = dim_row (N‚áßt * (M‚áßt))" by auto
next
  show "dim_col ((M * N)‚áßt) = dim_col (N‚áßt * (M‚áßt))" by auto
qed

lemma transpose_cnj_is_dagger [simp]:
  "(M‚áßt)‚áß‚ãÜ = (M‚áß‚Ä†)"
proof
  show f1:"dim_row ((M‚áßt)‚áß‚ãÜ) = dim_row (M‚áß‚Ä†)"
    by (simp add: cpx_mat_cnj_def transpose_mat_def dagger_def)
next
  show f2:"dim_col ((M‚áßt)‚áß‚ãÜ) = dim_col (M‚áß‚Ä†)" 
    by (simp add: cpx_mat_cnj_def transpose_mat_def dagger_def)
next
  fix i j::nat
  assume "i < dim_row M‚áß‚Ä†" and "j < dim_col M‚áß‚Ä†"
  then show "M‚áßt‚áß‚ãÜ $$ (i, j) = M‚áß‚Ä† $$ (i, j)" 
    by (simp add: cpx_mat_cnj_def transpose_mat_def dagger_def)
qed

lemma cnj_transpose_is_dagger [simp]:
  "(M‚áß‚ãÜ)‚áßt = (M‚áß‚Ä†)"
proof
  show "dim_row ((M‚áß‚ãÜ)‚áßt) = dim_row (M‚áß‚Ä†)" 
    by (simp add: transpose_mat_def cpx_mat_cnj_def dagger_def)
next
  show "dim_col ((M‚áß‚ãÜ)‚áßt) = dim_col (M‚áß‚Ä†)" 
    by (simp add: transpose_mat_def cpx_mat_cnj_def dagger_def)
next
  fix i j::nat
  assume "i < dim_row M‚áß‚Ä†" and "j < dim_col M‚áß‚Ä†"
  then show "M‚áß‚ãÜ‚áßt $$ (i, j) = M‚áß‚Ä† $$ (i, j)" 
    by (simp add: transpose_mat_def cpx_mat_cnj_def dagger_def)
qed

lemma dagger_of_transpose_is_cnj [simp]:
  "(M‚áßt)‚áß‚Ä† = (M‚áß‚ãÜ)"
  by (metis transpose_transpose transpose_cnj_is_dagger)

lemma dagger_of_prod:
  fixes M N::"complex Matrix.mat"
  assumes "dim_col M = dim_row N"
  shows "(M * N)‚áß‚Ä† = N‚áß‚Ä† * (M‚áß‚Ä†)"
proof-
  have "(M * N)‚áß‚Ä† = ((M * N)‚áß‚ãÜ)‚áßt" by auto
  also have "... = ((M‚áß‚ãÜ) * (N‚áß‚ãÜ))‚áßt" using assms cpx_mat_cnj_prod by auto
  also have "... = (N‚áß‚ãÜ)‚áßt * ((M‚áß‚ãÜ)‚áßt)" using assms transpose_of_prod 
    by (metis cnj_transpose_is_dagger dim_col_of_dagger dim_row_of_dagger index_transpose_mat(2) index_transpose_mat(3))
  finally show "(M * N)‚áß‚Ä† = N‚áß‚Ä† * (M‚áß‚Ä†)" by auto
qed

text ‚ÄπThe product of two quantum gates is a quantum gate.‚Ä∫

lemma prod_of_gate_is_gate: 
  assumes "gate n G1" and "gate n G2"
  shows "gate n (G1 * G2)"
proof
  show "dim_row (G1 * G2) = 2^n" using assms by (simp add: gate_def)
next
  show "square_mat (G1 * G2)" 
    using assms gate.dim_row gate.square_mat by simp
next
  show "unitary (G1 * G2)" 
  proof-
    have "((G1 * G2)‚áß‚Ä†) * (G1 * G2) = 1‚á©m (dim_col (G1 * G2))" 
    proof-
      have f0: "G1 ‚àà carrier_mat (2^n) (2^n) ‚àß G2 ‚àà carrier_mat (2^n) (2^n)
              ‚àß G1‚áß‚Ä† ‚àà carrier_mat (2^n) (2^n) ‚àß G2‚áß‚Ä† ‚àà carrier_mat (2^n) (2^n)
              ‚àß G1 * G2 ‚àà carrier_mat (2^n) (2^n)" 
        using assms gate.dim_row gate.square_mat by auto
      have "((G1 * G2)‚áß‚Ä†) * (G1 * G2) = ((G2‚áß‚Ä†) * (G1‚áß‚Ä†)) * (G1 * G2)" 
        using assms dagger_of_prod gate.dim_row gate.square_mat by simp
      also have "... = (G2‚áß‚Ä†) * ((G1‚áß‚Ä†) * (G1 * G2))" 
        using assms f0 by auto
      also have "... = (G2‚áß‚Ä†) * (((G1‚áß‚Ä†) * G1) * G2)" 
        using assms f0 f0 by auto
      also have "... = (G2‚áß‚Ä†) * ((1‚á©m (dim_col G1)) * G2)" 
        using gate.unitary[of n G1] assms unitary_def[of G1] by simp
      also have "... = (G2‚áß‚Ä†) * ((1‚á©m (dim_col G2)) * G2)" 
        using assms f0 by (metis carrier_matD(2))
      also have "... = (G2‚áß‚Ä†) * G2" 
        using f0 by (metis carrier_matD(2) left_mult_one_mat)
      finally show "((G1 * G2)‚áß‚Ä†) * (G1 * G2) = 1‚á©m (dim_col (G1 * G2))" 
        using assms gate.unitary unitary_def by simp
    qed
    moreover have "(G1 * G2) * ((G1 * G2)‚áß‚Ä†) = 1‚á©m (dim_row (G1 * G2))"
      using assms calculation
      by (smt carrier_matI dim_col_of_dagger dim_row_of_dagger gate.dim_row gate.square_mat index_mult_mat(2) index_mult_mat(3) 
          mat_mult_left_right_inverse square_mat.elims(2))
    ultimately show ?thesis using unitary_def by simp
  qed
qed

lemma left_inv_of_unitary_transpose [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U"
  shows "(U‚áßt)‚áß‚Ä† * (U‚áßt) =  1‚á©m(dim_row U)"
proof -
  have "dim_col U = dim_row ((U‚áßt)‚áß‚ãÜ)" by simp
  then have "(U * ((U‚áßt)‚áß‚ãÜ))‚áß‚ãÜ = (U‚áß‚ãÜ) * (U‚áßt)"
    using cpx_mat_cnj_prod cpx_mat_cnj_cnj by presburger
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (U‚áßt)‚áß‚Ä† * (U‚áßt)" by simp
  finally show ?thesis 
    using assms by (metis transpose_cnj_is_dagger cpx_mat_cnj_id unitary_def)
qed

lemma right_inv_of_unitary_transpose [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U"
  shows "U‚áßt * ((U‚áßt)‚áß‚Ä†) = 1‚á©m(dim_col U)"
proof -
  have "dim_col ((U‚áßt)‚áß‚ãÜ) = dim_row U" by simp
  then have "U‚áßt * ((U‚áßt)‚áß‚Ä†) = (((U‚áßt)‚áß‚ãÜ * U)‚áß‚ãÜ)"
    using cpx_mat_cnj_cnj cpx_mat_cnj_prod dagger_of_transpose_is_cnj by presburger
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (U‚áß‚Ä† * U)‚áß‚ãÜ" by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    using assms by (metis cpx_mat_cnj_id unitary_def)
qed

lemma transpose_of_unitary_is_unitary [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U"
  shows "unitary (U‚áßt)" 
  using unitary_def assms left_inv_of_unitary_transpose right_inv_of_unitary_transpose by simp


subsection "The Inner Product"

text ‚ÄπWe introduce a coercion between complex vectors and (column) complex matrices.‚Ä∫

definition ket_vec :: "complex vec ‚áí complex mat" ("|_‚ü©") where
"|v‚ü© ‚â° mat (dim_vec v) 1 (Œª(i,j). v $ i)"

lemma ket_vec_index [simp]:
  assumes "i < dim_vec v"
  shows "|v‚ü© $$ (i,0) = v $ i"
  using assms ket_vec_def by simp

lemma ket_vec_col [simp]:
  "col |v‚ü© 0 = v"
  by (auto simp: col_def ket_vec_def)

lemma smult_ket_vec [simp]:
  "|x ‚ãÖ‚á©v v‚ü© = x ‚ãÖ‚á©m |v‚ü©"
  by (auto simp: ket_vec_def)

lemma smult_vec_length_bis [simp]:
  assumes "x ‚â• 0"
  shows "‚à•col (complex_of_real(x) ‚ãÖ‚á©m |v‚ü©) 0‚à• = x * ‚à•v‚à•"
  using assms smult_ket_vec smult_vec_length ket_vec_col by metis

declare [[coercion ket_vec]]

definition row_vec :: "complex vec ‚áí complex mat" where
"row_vec v ‚â° mat 1 (dim_vec v) (Œª(i,j). v $ j)" 

definition bra_vec :: "complex vec ‚áí complex mat" where
"bra_vec v ‚â° (row_vec v)‚áß‚ãÜ"

lemma row_bra_vec [simp]:
  "row (bra_vec v) 0 = vec (dim_vec v) (Œªi. cnj(v $ i))"
  by (auto simp: row_def bra_vec_def cpx_mat_cnj_def row_vec_def)

text ‚ÄπWe introduce a definition called @{term "bra"} to see a vector as a column matrix.‚Ä∫

definition bra :: "complex mat ‚áí complex mat" ("‚ü®_|") where
"‚ü®v| ‚â° mat 1 (dim_row v) (Œª(i,j). cnj(v $$ (j,i)))"

text ‚ÄπThe relation between @{term "bra"}, @{term "bra_vec"} and @{term "ket_vec"} is given as follows.‚Ä∫

lemma bra_bra_vec [simp]:
  "bra (ket_vec v) = bra_vec v"
  by (auto simp: bra_def ket_vec_def bra_vec_def cpx_mat_cnj_def row_vec_def)

lemma row_bra [simp]:
  fixes v::"complex vec"
  shows "row ‚ü®v| 0 = vec (dim_vec v) (Œªi. cnj (v $ i))" by simp

text ‚ÄπWe introduce the inner product of two complex vectors in @{text "‚ÑÇ‚áßn"}.‚Ä∫

definition inner_prod :: "complex vec ‚áí complex vec ‚áí complex" ("‚ü®_|_‚ü©") where
"inner_prod u v ‚â° ‚àë i ‚àà {0..< dim_vec v}. cnj(u $ i) * (v $ i)"

lemma inner_prod_with_row_bra_vec [simp]:
  assumes "dim_vec u = dim_vec v"
  shows "‚ü®u|v‚ü© = row (bra_vec u) 0 ‚àô v"
  using assms inner_prod_def scalar_prod_def row_bra_vec index_vec
  by (smt lessThan_atLeast0 lessThan_iff sum.cong)

lemma inner_prod_with_row_bra_vec_col_ket_vec [simp]:
  assumes "dim_vec u = dim_vec v"
  shows "‚ü®u|v‚ü© = (row ‚ü®u| 0) ‚àô (col |v‚ü© 0)"
  using assms by (simp add: inner_prod_def scalar_prod_def)

lemma inner_prod_with_times_mat [simp]:
  assumes "dim_vec u = dim_vec v"
  shows "‚ü®u|v‚ü© = (‚ü®u| * |v‚ü©) $$ (0,0)"
  using assms inner_prod_with_row_bra_vec_col_ket_vec 
  by (simp add: inner_prod_def times_mat_def ket_vec_def bra_def)

lemma orthogonal_unit_vec [simp]:
  assumes "i < n" and "j < n" and "i ‚â† j"
  shows "‚ü®unit_vec n i|unit_vec n j‚ü© = 0"
proof-
  have "‚ü®unit_vec n i|unit_vec n j‚ü© = unit_vec n i ‚àô unit_vec n j"
    using assms unit_vec_def inner_prod_def scalar_prod_def
    by (smt complex_cnj_zero index_unit_vec(3) index_vec inner_prod_with_row_bra_vec row_bra_vec 
        scalar_prod_right_unit)
  thus ?thesis
    using assms scalar_prod_def unit_vec_def by simp 
qed

text ‚ÄπWe prove that our inner product is linear in its second argument.‚Ä∫

lemma vec_index_is_linear [simp]:
  assumes "dim_vec u = dim_vec v" and "j < dim_vec u"
  shows "(k ‚ãÖ‚á©v u + l ‚ãÖ‚á©v v) $ j = k * (u $ j) + l * (v $ j)"
  using assms vec_index_def smult_vec_def plus_vec_def by simp

lemma inner_prod_is_linear [simp]:
  fixes u::"complex vec" and v::"nat ‚áí complex vec" and l::"nat ‚áí complex"
  assumes "‚àÄi‚àà{0, 1}. dim_vec u = dim_vec (v i)"
  shows "‚ü®u|l 0 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v 0 + l 1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v 1‚ü© = (‚àëi‚â§1. l i * ‚ü®u|v i‚ü©)"
proof -
  have f1:"dim_vec (l 0 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v 0 + l 1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v 1) = dim_vec u"
    using assms by simp
  then have "‚ü®u|l 0 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v 0 + l 1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v 1‚ü© = (‚àëi‚àà{0 ..< dim_vec u}. cnj (u $ i) * ((l 0 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v 0 + l 1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v 1) $ i))"
    by (simp add: inner_prod_def)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àëi‚àà{0 ..< dim_vec u}. cnj (u $ i) * (l 0 * v 0 $ i + l 1 * v 1 $ i))"
    using assms by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ = l 0 * (‚àëi‚àà{0 ..< dim_vec u}. cnj(u $ i) * (v 0 $ i)) + l 1 * (‚àëi‚àà{0 ..< dim_vec u}. cnj(u $ i) * (v 1 $ i))"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
      (simp add: sum.distrib sum_distrib_left)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = l 0 * ‚ü®u|v 0‚ü© + l 1 * ‚ü®u|v 1‚ü©"
    using assms inner_prod_def by auto
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma inner_prod_cnj:
  assumes "dim_vec u = dim_vec v"
  shows "‚ü®v|u‚ü© = cnj (‚ü®u|v‚ü©)"
  by (simp add: assms inner_prod_def algebra_simps)

lemma inner_prod_with_itself_Im [simp]:
  "Im (‚ü®u|u‚ü©) = 0"
  using inner_prod_cnj by (metis Reals_cnj_iff complex_is_Real_iff)

lemma inner_prod_with_itself_real [simp]:
  "‚ü®u|u‚ü© ‚àà ‚Ñù"
  using inner_prod_with_itself_Im by (simp add: complex_is_Real_iff)

lemma inner_prod_with_itself_eq0 [simp]:
  assumes "u = 0‚á©v (dim_vec u)"
  shows "‚ü®u|u‚ü© = 0"
  using assms inner_prod_def zero_vec_def
  by (smt atLeastLessThan_iff complex_cnj_zero index_zero_vec(1) mult_zero_left sum.neutral)

lemma inner_prod_with_itself_Re:
  "Re (‚ü®u|u‚ü©) ‚â• 0"
proof -
  have "Re (‚ü®u|u‚ü©) = (‚àëi<dim_vec u. Re (cnj(u $ i) * (u $ i)))"
    by (simp add: inner_prod_def lessThan_atLeast0)
  moreover have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àëi<dim_vec u. (Re (u $ i))‚áß2 + (Im (u $ i))‚áß2)"
    using complex_mult_cnj
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) Re_complex_of_real semiring_normalization_rules(7))
  ultimately show "Re (‚ü®u|u‚ü©) ‚â• 0" by (simp add: sum_nonneg)
qed

lemma inner_prod_with_itself_nonneg_reals:
  fixes u::"complex vec"
  shows "‚ü®u|u‚ü© ‚àà nonneg_Reals"
  using inner_prod_with_itself_real inner_prod_with_itself_Re complex_nonneg_Reals_iff 
inner_prod_with_itself_Im by auto

lemma inner_prod_with_itself_Re_non0:
  assumes "u ‚â† 0‚á©v (dim_vec u)"
  shows "Re (‚ü®u|u‚ü©) > 0"
proof -
  obtain i where a1:"i < dim_vec u" and "u $ i ‚â† 0"
    using assms zero_vec_def by (metis dim_vec eq_vecI index_zero_vec(1))
  then have f1:"Re (cnj (u $ i) * (u $ i)) > 0"
    by (metis Re_complex_of_real complex_mult_cnj complex_neq_0 mult.commute)
  moreover have f2:"Re (‚ü®u|u‚ü©) = (‚àëi<dim_vec u. Re (cnj(u $ i) * (u $ i)))"
    using inner_prod_def by (simp add: lessThan_atLeast0)
  moreover have f3:"‚àÄi<dim_vec u. Re (cnj(u $ i) * (u $ i)) ‚â• 0"
    using complex_mult_cnj by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using a1 inner_prod_def lessThan_iff
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) finite_lessThan sum_pos2)
qed

lemma inner_prod_with_itself_nonneg_reals_non0:
  assumes "u ‚â† 0‚á©v (dim_vec u)"
  shows "‚ü®u|u‚ü© ‚â† 0"
  using assms inner_prod_with_itself_Re_non0 by fastforce

lemma cpx_vec_length_inner_prod [simp]:
  "‚à•v‚à•‚áß2 = ‚ü®v|v‚ü©"
proof -
  have "‚à•v‚à•‚áß2 = (‚àëi<dim_vec v. (cmod (v $ i))‚áß2)"
    using cpx_vec_length_def complex_of_real_def
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) real_sqrt_power real_sqrt_unique sum_nonneg zero_le_power2)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àëi<dim_vec v. cnj (v $ i) * (v $ i))"
    using complex_norm_square mult.commute by (smt of_real_sum sum.cong)
  finally show ?thesis
    using inner_prod_def by (simp add: lessThan_atLeast0)
qed

lemma inner_prod_csqrt [simp]:
  "csqrt ‚ü®v|v‚ü© = ‚à•v‚à•"
  using inner_prod_with_itself_Re inner_prod_with_itself_Im csqrt_of_real_nonneg cpx_vec_length_def
  by (metis (no_types, lifting) Re_complex_of_real cpx_vec_length_inner_prod real_sqrt_ge_0_iff 
      real_sqrt_unique sum_nonneg zero_le_power2)


subsection "Unitary Matrices and Length-Preservation"

subsubsection "Unitary Matrices are Length-Preserving"

text ‚ÄπThe bra-vector @{text "‚ü®A * v|"} is given by @{text "‚ü®v| * A‚áß‚Ä†"}‚Ä∫

lemma dagger_of_ket_is_bra:
  fixes v:: "complex vec"
  shows "( |v‚ü© )‚áß‚Ä† = ‚ü®v|"
  by (simp add: bra_def dagger_def ket_vec_def)

lemma bra_mat_on_vec:
  fixes v::"complex vec" and A::"complex mat"
  assumes "dim_col A = dim_vec v"
  shows "‚ü®A * v| = ‚ü®v| * (A‚áß‚Ä†)"
proof
  show "dim_row ‚ü®A * v| = dim_row (‚ü®v| * (A‚áß‚Ä†))"
    by (simp add: bra_def times_mat_def)
next
  show "dim_col ‚ü®A * v| = dim_col (‚ü®v| * (A‚áß‚Ä†))"
    by (simp add: bra_def times_mat_def)
next
  fix i j::nat
  assume a1:"i < dim_row (‚ü®v| * (A‚áß‚Ä†))" and a2:"j < dim_col (‚ü®v| * (A‚áß‚Ä†))" 
  then have "cnj((A * v) $$ (j,0)) = cnj (row A j ‚àô v)"
    using bra_def times_mat_def ket_vec_col ket_vec_def by simp
  also have f7:"‚Ä¶= (‚àëi‚àà{0 ..< dim_vec v}. cnj(v $ i) * cnj(A $$ (j,i)))"
    using row_def scalar_prod_def cnj_sum complex_cnj_mult mult.commute
    by (smt assms index_vec lessThan_atLeast0 lessThan_iff sum.cong)
  moreover have f8:"(row ‚ü®v| 0) ‚àô (col (A‚áß‚Ä†) j) = 
    vec (dim_vec v) (Œªi. cnj (v $ i)) ‚àô vec (dim_col A) (Œªi. cnj (A $$ (j,i)))"
    using a2 by simp 
  ultimately have "cnj((A * v) $$ (j,0)) = (row ‚ü®v| 0) ‚àô (col (A‚áß‚Ä†) j)"
    using assms scalar_prod_def
    by (smt dim_vec index_vec lessThan_atLeast0 lessThan_iff sum.cong)
  then have "‚ü®A * v| $$ (0,j) = (‚ü®v| * (A‚áß‚Ä†)) $$ (0,j)"
    using bra_def times_mat_def a2 by simp
  thus "‚ü®A * |v‚ü©| $$ (i, j) = (‚ü®v| * (A‚áß‚Ä†)) $$ (i, j)" 
    using a1 by (simp add: times_mat_def bra_def)
qed

lemma mat_on_ket:
  fixes v:: "complex vec" and A:: "complex mat"
  assumes "dim_col A = dim_vec v"
  shows "A * |v‚ü© = |col (A * v) 0‚ü©"
  using assms ket_vec_def by auto

lemma dagger_of_mat_on_ket:
  fixes v:: "complex vec" and A :: "complex mat"
  assumes "dim_col A = dim_vec v"
  shows "(A * |v‚ü© )‚áß‚Ä† = ‚ü®v| * (A‚áß‚Ä†)"
  using assms by (metis bra_mat_on_vec dagger_of_ket_is_bra mat_on_ket)

definition col_fst :: "'a mat ‚áí 'a vec" where 
  "col_fst A = vec (dim_row A) (Œª i. A $$ (i,0))"

lemma col_fst_is_col [simp]:
  "col_fst M = col M 0"
  by (simp add: col_def col_fst_def)

text ‚Äπ
We need to declare @{term "col_fst"} as a coercion from matrices to vectors in order to see a column 
matrix as a vector. 
‚Ä∫

declare 
  [[coercion_delete ket_vec]]
  [[coercion col_fst]]

lemma unit_vec_to_col:
  assumes "dim_col A = n" and "i < n"
  shows "col A i = A * |unit_vec n i‚ü©"
proof
  show "dim_vec (col A i) = dim_vec (A * |unit_vec n i‚ü©)"
    using col_def times_mat_def by simp
next
  fix j::nat
  assume "j < dim_vec (col_fst (A * |unit_vec n i‚ü©))"
  then show "col A i $ j = (A * |unit_vec n i‚ü©) $ j"
    using assms times_mat_def ket_vec_def
    by (smt col_fst_is_col dim_col dim_col_mat(1) index_col index_mult_mat(1) index_mult_mat(2) 
index_row(1) ket_vec_col less_numeral_extra(1) scalar_prod_right_unit)
qed

lemma mult_ket_vec_is_ket_vec_of_mult:
  fixes A::"complex mat" and v::"complex vec"
  assumes "dim_col A = dim_vec v"
  shows "|A * |v‚ü© ‚ü© = A * |v‚ü©"
  using assms ket_vec_def
  by (metis One_nat_def col_fst_is_col dim_col dim_col_mat(1) index_mult_mat(3) ket_vec_col less_Suc0 
mat_col_eqI)

lemma unitary_is_sq_length_preserving [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_vec v = dim_col U"
  shows "‚à•U * |v‚ü©‚à•‚áß2 = ‚à•v‚à•‚áß2"
proof -
  have "‚ü®U * |v‚ü©|U * |v‚ü© ‚ü© = (‚ü®|v‚ü©| * (U‚áß‚Ä†) * |U * |v‚ü©‚ü©) $$ (0,0)"
    using assms(2) bra_mat_on_vec
    by (metis inner_prod_with_times_mat mult_ket_vec_is_ket_vec_of_mult)
  then have "‚ü®U * |v‚ü©|U * |v‚ü© ‚ü© = (‚ü®|v‚ü©| * (U‚áß‚Ä†) * (U * |v‚ü©)) $$ (0,0)"
    using assms(2) mult_ket_vec_is_ket_vec_of_mult by simp
  moreover have f1:"dim_col ‚ü®|v‚ü©| = dim_vec v"
    using ket_vec_def bra_def by simp
  moreover have "dim_row (U‚áß‚Ä†) = dim_vec v"
    using assms(2) by simp
  ultimately have "‚ü®U * |v‚ü©|U * |v‚ü© ‚ü© = (‚ü®|v‚ü©| * ((U‚áß‚Ä†) * U) * |v‚ü©) $$ (0,0)"
    using assoc_mult_mat
    by(smt carrier_mat_triv dim_row_mat(1) dagger_def ket_vec_def mat_carrier times_mat_def)
  then have "‚ü®U * |v‚ü©|U * |v‚ü© ‚ü© = (‚ü®|v‚ü©| * |v‚ü©) $$ (0,0)"
    using assms f1 unitary_def by simp
  thus ?thesis
    using cpx_vec_length_inner_prod by(metis Re_complex_of_real inner_prod_with_times_mat)
qed

lemma col_ket_vec [simp]:
  assumes "dim_col M = 1"
  shows "|col M 0‚ü© = M"
  using eq_matI assms ket_vec_def by auto

lemma state_col_ket_vec:
  assumes "state 1 v"
  shows "state 1 |col v 0‚ü©"
  using assms by (simp add: state_def)

lemma col_ket_vec_index [simp]:
  assumes "i < dim_row v"
  shows "|col v 0‚ü© $$ (i,0) = v $$ (i,0)"
  using assms ket_vec_def by (simp add: col_def)

lemma col_index_of_mat_col [simp]:
  assumes "dim_col v = 1" and "i < dim_row v"
  shows "col v 0 $ i = v $$ (i,0)"
  using assms by simp

lemma unitary_is_sq_length_preserving_bis [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_row v = dim_col U" and "dim_col v = 1"
  shows "‚à•col (U * v) 0‚à•‚áß2 = ‚à•col v 0‚à•‚áß2"
proof -
  have "dim_vec (col v 0) = dim_col U"
    using assms(2) by simp
  then have "‚à•col_fst (U * |col v 0‚ü©)‚à•‚áß2 = ‚à•col v 0‚à•‚áß2"
    using unitary_is_sq_length_preserving[of "U" "col v 0"] assms(1) by simp
  thus ?thesis
    using assms(3) by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ 
A unitary matrix is length-preserving, i.e. it acts on a vector to produce another vector of the 
same length. 
‚Ä∫

lemma unitary_is_length_preserving_bis [simp]:
  fixes U::"complex mat" and v::"complex mat"
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_row v = dim_col U" and "dim_col v = 1"
  shows "‚à•col (U * v) 0‚à• = ‚à•col v 0‚à•"
  using assms unitary_is_sq_length_preserving_bis
  by (metis cpx_vec_length_inner_prod inner_prod_csqrt of_real_hom.injectivity)

lemma unitary_is_length_preserving [simp]:
  fixes U:: "complex mat" and v:: "complex vec"
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_vec v = dim_col U"
  shows "‚à•U * |v‚ü©‚à• = ‚à•v‚à•"
  using assms unitary_is_sq_length_preserving
  by (metis cpx_vec_length_inner_prod inner_prod_csqrt of_real_hom.injectivity)


subsubsection "Length-Preserving Matrices are Unitary"

lemma inverts_mat_sym:
  fixes A B:: "complex mat"
  assumes "inverts_mat A B" and "dim_row B = dim_col A" and "square_mat B"
  shows "inverts_mat B A"
proof-
  define n where d0:"n = dim_row B"
  have "A * B = 1‚á©m (dim_row A)" using assms(1) inverts_mat_def by auto
  moreover have "dim_col B = dim_col (A * B)" using times_mat_def by simp
  ultimately have "dim_col B = dim_row A" by simp
  then have c0:"A ‚àà carrier_mat n n" using assms(2,3) d0 by auto
  have c1:"B ‚àà carrier_mat n n" using assms(3) d0 by auto
  have f0:"A * B = 1‚á©m n" using inverts_mat_def c0 c1 assms(1) by auto
  have f1:"det B ‚â† 0"
  proof
    assume "det B = 0"
    then have "‚àÉv. v ‚àà carrier_vec n ‚àß v ‚â† 0‚á©v n ‚àß B *‚á©v v = 0‚á©v n"
      using det_0_iff_vec_prod_zero assms(3) c1 by blast
    then obtain v where d1:"v ‚àà carrier_vec n ‚àß v ‚â† 0‚á©v n ‚àß B *‚á©v v = 0‚á©v n" by auto
    then have d2:"dim_vec v = n" by simp
    have "B * |v‚ü© = |0‚á©v n‚ü©"
    proof
      show "dim_row (B * |v‚ü©) = dim_row |0‚á©v n‚ü©" using ket_vec_def d0 by simp
    next
      show "dim_col (B * |v‚ü©) = dim_col |0‚á©v n‚ü©" using ket_vec_def d0 by simp
    next
      fix i j assume "i < dim_row |0‚á©v n‚ü©" and "j < dim_col |0‚á©v n‚ü©"
      then have f2:"i < n ‚àß j = 0" using ket_vec_def by simp
      moreover have "vec (dim_row B) (($) v) = v" using d0 d1 by auto
      moreover have "(B *‚á©v v) $ i = (‚àëia = 0..<dim_row B. row B i $ ia * v $ ia)"
        using d0 d2 f2 by (auto simp add: scalar_prod_def)
      ultimately show "(B * |v‚ü©) $$ (i, j) = |0‚á©v n‚ü© $$ (i, j)"
        using ket_vec_def d0 d1 times_mat_def mult_mat_vec_def by (auto simp add: scalar_prod_def)
    qed
    moreover have "|v‚ü© ‚àà carrier_mat n 1" using d2 ket_vec_def by simp
    ultimately have "(A * B) * |v‚ü© = A * |0‚á©v n‚ü©" using c0 c1 by simp
    then have f3:"|v‚ü© = A * |0‚á©v n‚ü©" using d2 f0 ket_vec_def by auto
    have "v = 0‚á©v n"
    proof
      show "dim_vec v = dim_vec (0‚á©v n)" using d2 by simp
    next
      fix i assume f4:"i < dim_vec (0‚á©v n)"
      then have "|v‚ü© $$ (i,0) = v $ i" using d2 ket_vec_def by simp
      moreover have "(A * |0‚á©v n‚ü©) $$ (i, 0) = 0"
        using ket_vec_def times_mat_def scalar_prod_def f4 c0 by auto
      ultimately show "v $ i = 0‚á©v n $ i" using f3 f4 by simp
    qed
    then show False using d1 by simp
  qed
  have f5:"adj_mat B ‚àà carrier_mat n n ‚àß B * adj_mat B = det B ‚ãÖ‚á©m 1‚á©m n" using c1 adj_mat by auto
  then have c2:"((1/det B) ‚ãÖ‚á©m adj_mat B) ‚àà carrier_mat n n" by simp
  have f6:"B * ((1/det B) ‚ãÖ‚á©m adj_mat B) = 1‚á©m n" using c1 f1 f5 mult_smult_distrib[of "B"] by auto
  then have "A = (A * B) * ((1/det B) ‚ãÖ‚á©m adj_mat B)" using c0 c1 c2 by simp
  then have "A = (1/det B) ‚ãÖ‚á©m adj_mat B" using f0 c2 by auto
  then show ?thesis using c0 c1 f6 inverts_mat_def by auto
qed

lemma sum_of_unit_vec_length:
  fixes i j n:: nat and c:: complex
  assumes "i < n" and "j < n" and "i ‚â† j"
  shows "‚à•unit_vec n i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v unit_vec n j‚à•‚áß2 = 1 + cnj(c) * c"
proof-
  define v where d0:"v = unit_vec n i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v unit_vec n j"
  have "‚àÄk<n. v $ k = (if k = i then 1 else (if k = j then c else 0))"
    using d0 assms(1,2,3) by auto
  then have "‚àÄk<n. cnj (v $ k) * v $ k = (if k = i then 1 else 0) + (if k = j then cnj(c) * c else 0)"
    using assms(3) by auto
  moreover have "‚à•v‚à•‚áß2 = (‚àëk = 0..<n. cnj (v $ k) * v $ k)"
    using d0 assms cpx_vec_length_inner_prod inner_prod_def by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using d0 assms by (auto simp add: sum.distrib)
qed

lemma sum_of_unit_vec_to_col:
  assumes "dim_col A = n" and "i < n" and "j < n"
  shows "col A i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v col A j = A * |unit_vec n i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v unit_vec n j‚ü©"
proof
  show "dim_vec (col A i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v col A j) = dim_vec (col_fst (A * |unit_vec n i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v unit_vec n j‚ü©))"
    using assms(1) by auto
next
  fix k assume "k < dim_vec (col_fst (A * |unit_vec n i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v unit_vec n j‚ü©))"
  then have f0:"k < dim_row A" using assms(1) by auto
  have "(col A i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v col A j) $ k = A $$ (k, i) + c * A $$ (k, j)"
    using f0 assms(1-3) by auto
  moreover have "(‚àëx<n. A $$ (k, x) * ((if x = i then 1 else 0) + c * (if x = j then 1 else 0))) = 
                 (‚àëx<n. A $$ (k, x) * (if x = i then 1 else 0)) + 
                 (‚àëx<n. A $$ (k, x) * c * (if x = j then 1 else 0))"
    by (auto simp add: sum.distrib algebra_simps)
  moreover have "‚àÄx<n. A $$ (k, x) * (if x = i then 1 else 0) = (if x = i then A $$ (k, x) else 0)"
    by simp
  moreover have "‚àÄx<n. A $$ (k, x) * c * (if x = j then 1 else 0) = (if x = j then A $$ (k, x) * c else 0)"
    by simp
  ultimately show "(col A i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v col A j) $ k = col_fst (A * |unit_vec n i + c ‚ãÖ‚á©v unit_vec n j‚ü©) $ k"
    using f0 assms(1-3) times_mat_def scalar_prod_def ket_vec_def by auto
qed

lemma inner_prod_is_sesquilinear:
  fixes u1 u2 v1 v2:: "complex vec" and c1 c2 c3 c4:: complex and n:: nat
  assumes "dim_vec u1 = n" and "dim_vec u2 = n" and "dim_vec v1 = n" and "dim_vec v2 = n"
  shows "‚ü®c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2|c3 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v1 + c4 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v2‚ü© = cnj (c1) * c3 * ‚ü®u1|v1‚ü© + cnj (c2) * c3 * ‚ü®u2|v1‚ü© + 
                                                 cnj (c1) * c4 * ‚ü®u1|v2‚ü© + cnj (c2) * c4 * ‚ü®u2|v2‚ü©"
proof-
  have "‚ü®c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2|c3 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v1 + c4 ‚ãÖ‚á©v v2‚ü© = c3 * ‚ü®c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2|v1‚ü© + c4 * ‚ü®c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2|v2‚ü©"
    using inner_prod_is_linear[of "c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2" "Œªi. if i = 0 then v1 else v2" 
                                  "Œªi. if i = 0 then c3 else c4"] assms
    by simp
  also have "... = c3 * cnj(‚ü®v1|c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2‚ü©) + c4 * cnj(‚ü®v2|c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2‚ü©)"
    using assms inner_prod_cnj[of "v1" "c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2"] inner_prod_cnj[of "v2" "c1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u1 + c2 ‚ãÖ‚á©v u2"] 
    by simp
  also have "... = c3 * cnj(c1 * ‚ü®v1|u1‚ü© + c2 * ‚ü®v1|u2‚ü©) + c4 * cnj(c1 * ‚ü®v2|u1‚ü© + c2 * ‚ü®v2|u2‚ü©)"
    using inner_prod_is_linear[of "v1" "Œªi. if i = 0 then u1 else u2" "Œªi. if i = 0 then c1 else c2"] 
          inner_prod_is_linear[of "v2" "Œªi. if i = 0 then u1 else u2" "Œªi. if i = 0 then c1 else c2"] assms
    by simp
  also have "... = c3 * (cnj(c1) * ‚ü®u1|v1‚ü© + cnj(c2) * ‚ü®u2|v1‚ü©) + 
                   c4 * (cnj(c1) * ‚ü®u1|v2‚ü© + cnj(c2) * ‚ü®u2|v2‚ü©)"
    using inner_prod_cnj[of "v1" "u1"] inner_prod_cnj[of "v1" "u2"] 
          inner_prod_cnj[of "v2" "u1"] inner_prod_cnj[of "v2" "u2"] assms
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    by (auto simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

text ‚Äπ
A length-preserving matrix is unitary. So, unitary matrices are exactly the length-preserving
matrices.
‚Ä∫

lemma length_preserving_is_unitary:
  fixes U:: "complex mat"
  assumes "square_mat U" and "‚àÄv::complex vec. dim_vec v = dim_col U ‚ü∂ ‚à•U * |v‚ü©‚à• = ‚à•v‚à•"
  shows "unitary U"
proof-
  define n where "n = dim_col U"
  then have c0:"U ‚àà carrier_mat n n" using assms(1) by auto
  then have c1:"U‚áß‚Ä† ‚àà carrier_mat n n" using assms(1) dagger_def by auto
  have f0:"(U‚áß‚Ä†) * U = 1‚á©m (dim_col U)"
  proof
    show "dim_row (U‚áß‚Ä† * U) = dim_row (1‚á©m (dim_col U))" using c0 by simp
  next
    show "dim_col (U‚áß‚Ä† * U) = dim_col (1‚á©m (dim_col U))" using c0 by simp
  next
    fix i j assume "i < dim_row (1‚á©m (dim_col U))" and "j < dim_col (1‚á©m (dim_col U))"
    then have a0:"i < n ‚àß j < n" using c0 by simp
    have f1:"‚ãÄl. l<n ‚ü∂ (‚àëk<n. cnj (U $$ (k, l)) * U $$ (k, l)) = 1"
    proof
      fix l assume a1:"l<n"
      define v::"complex vec" where d1:"v = unit_vec n l"
      have "‚à•col U l‚à•‚áß2 = (‚àëk<n. cnj (U $$ (k, l)) * U $$ (k, l))"
        using c0 a1 cpx_vec_length_inner_prod inner_prod_def lessThan_atLeast0 by simp
      moreover have "‚à•col U l‚à•‚áß2 = ‚à•v‚à•‚áß2" using c0 d1 a1 assms(2) unit_vec_to_col by simp
      moreover have "‚à•v‚à•‚áß2 = 1" using d1 a1 cpx_vec_length_inner_prod by simp
      ultimately show "(‚àëk<n. cnj (U $$ (k, l)) * U $$ (k, l)) = 1" by simp
    qed
    moreover have "i ‚â† j ‚ü∂ (‚àëk<n. cnj (U $$ (k, i)) * U $$ (k, j)) = 0"
    proof
      assume a2:"i ‚â† j"
      define v1::"complex vec" where d1:"v1 = unit_vec n i + 1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v unit_vec n j"
      define v2::"complex vec" where d2:"v2 = unit_vec n i + ùóÇ ‚ãÖ‚á©v unit_vec n j"
      have "‚à•v1‚à•‚áß2 = 1 + cnj 1 * 1" using d1 a0 a2 sum_of_unit_vec_length by blast
      then have "‚à•v1‚à•‚áß2 = 2"
        by (metis complex_cnj_one cpx_vec_length_inner_prod mult.left_neutral of_real_eq_iff 
            of_real_numeral one_add_one)
      then have "‚à•U * |v1‚ü©‚à•‚áß2 = 2" using c0 d1 assms(2) unit_vec_to_col by simp
      moreover have "col U i + 1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v col U j = U * |v1‚ü©"
        using c0 d1 a0 sum_of_unit_vec_to_col by blast
      moreover have "col U i + 1 ‚ãÖ‚á©v col U j = col U i + col U j" by simp
      ultimately have "‚ü®col U i + col U j|col U i + col U j‚ü© = 2"
        using cpx_vec_length_inner_prod by (metis of_real_numeral)
      moreover have "‚ü®col U i + col U j|col U i + col U j‚ü© = 
               ‚ü®col U i|col U i‚ü© + ‚ü®col U j|col U i‚ü© + ‚ü®col U i|col U j‚ü© + ‚ü®col U j|col U j‚ü©"
        using inner_prod_is_sesquilinear[of "col U i" "dim_row U" "col U j" "col U i" "col U j" "1" "1" "1" "1"]
        by simp
      ultimately have f2:"‚ü®col U j|col U i‚ü© + ‚ü®col U i|col U j‚ü© = 0"
        using c0 a0 f1 inner_prod_def lessThan_atLeast0 by simp

      have "‚à•v2‚à•‚áß2 = 1 + cnj ùóÇ * ùóÇ" using a0 a2 d2 sum_of_unit_vec_length by simp
      then have "‚à•v2‚à•‚áß2 = 2"
        by (metis Re_complex_of_real complex_norm_square mult.commute norm_ii numeral_Bit0 
            numeral_One numeral_eq_one_iff of_real_numeral one_power2)
      moreover have "‚à•U * |v2‚ü©‚à•‚áß2 = ‚à•v2‚à•‚áß2" using c0 d2 assms(2) unit_vec_to_col by simp
      moreover have "‚ü®col U i + ùóÇ ‚ãÖ‚á©v col U j|col U i + ùóÇ ‚ãÖ‚á©v col U j‚ü© = ‚à•U * |v2‚ü©‚à•‚áß2"
        using c0 a0 d2 sum_of_unit_vec_to_col cpx_vec_length_inner_prod by auto
      moreover have "‚ü®col U i + ùóÇ ‚ãÖ‚á©v col U j|col U i + ùóÇ ‚ãÖ‚á©v col U j‚ü© = 
                     ‚ü®col U i|col U i‚ü© + (-ùóÇ) * ‚ü®col U j|col U i‚ü© + ùóÇ * ‚ü®col U i|col U j‚ü© + ‚ü®col U j|col U j‚ü©"
        using inner_prod_is_sesquilinear[of "col U i" "dim_row U" "col U j" "col U i" "col U j" "1" "ùóÇ" "1" "ùóÇ"]
        by simp
      ultimately have "‚ü®col U j|col U i‚ü© - ‚ü®col U i|col U j‚ü© = 0"
        using c0 a0 f1 inner_prod_def lessThan_atLeast0 by auto
      then show "(‚àëk<n. cnj (U $$ (k, i)) * U $$ (k, j)) = 0"
        using c0 a0 f2 lessThan_atLeast0 inner_prod_def by auto
    qed
    ultimately show "(U‚áß‚Ä† * U) $$ (i, j) = 1‚á©m (dim_col U) $$ (i, j)"
      using c0 assms(1) a0 one_mat_def dagger_def by auto
qed
  then have "(U‚áß‚Ä†) * U = 1‚á©m n" using c0 by simp
  then have "inverts_mat (U‚áß‚Ä†) U" using c1 inverts_mat_def by auto
  then have "inverts_mat U (U‚áß‚Ä†)" using c0 c1 inverts_mat_sym by simp
  then have "U * (U‚áß‚Ä†) = 1‚á©m (dim_row U)" using c0 inverts_mat_def by auto
  then show ?thesis using f0 unitary_def by simp
qed

lemma inner_prod_with_unitary_mat [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_vec u = dim_col U" and "dim_vec v = dim_col U"
  shows "‚ü®U * |u‚ü©|U * |v‚ü©‚ü© = ‚ü®u|v‚ü©"
proof -
  have f1:"‚ü®U * |u‚ü©|U * |v‚ü©‚ü© = (‚ü®|u‚ü©| * (U‚áß‚Ä†) * U * |v‚ü©) $$ (0,0)"
    using assms(2-3) bra_mat_on_vec mult_ket_vec_is_ket_vec_of_mult
    by (smt assoc_mult_mat carrier_mat_triv col_fst_def dim_vec dim_col_of_dagger index_mult_mat(2) 
        index_mult_mat(3) inner_prod_with_times_mat ket_vec_def mat_carrier)
  moreover have f2:"‚ü®|u‚ü©| ‚àà carrier_mat 1 (dim_vec v)"
    using bra_def ket_vec_def assms(2-3) by simp
  moreover have f3:"U‚áß‚Ä† ‚àà carrier_mat (dim_col U) (dim_row U)"
    using dagger_def by simp
  ultimately have "‚ü®U * |u‚ü©|U * |v‚ü©‚ü© = (‚ü®|u‚ü©| * (U‚áß‚Ä† * U) * |v‚ü©) $$ (0,0)"
    using assms(3) assoc_mult_mat by (metis carrier_mat_triv)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚ü®|u‚ü©| * |v‚ü©) $$ (0,0)"
    using assms(1) unitary_def
    by (simp add: assms(2) bra_def ket_vec_def)
  finally show ?thesis
    using assms(2-3) inner_prod_with_times_mat by presburger
qed

text ‚ÄπAs a consequence we prove that columns and rows of a unitary matrix are orthonormal vectors.‚Ä∫

lemma unitary_unit_col [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_col U = n" and "i < n"
  shows "‚à•col U i‚à• = 1"
  using assms unit_vec_to_col unitary_is_length_preserving by simp

lemma unitary_unit_row [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_row U = n" and "i < n"
  shows "‚à•row U i‚à• = 1"
proof -
  have "row U i = col (U‚áßt) i"
    using  assms(2-3) by simp
  thus ?thesis
    using assms transpose_of_unitary_is_unitary unitary_unit_col
    by (metis index_transpose_mat(3))
qed

lemma orthogonal_col_of_unitary [simp]:
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_col U = n" and "i < n" and "j < n" and "i ‚â† j"
  shows "‚ü®col U i|col U j‚ü© = 0"
proof -
  have "‚ü®col U i|col U j‚ü© = ‚ü®U * |unit_vec n i‚ü©| U * |unit_vec n j‚ü©‚ü©"
    using assms(2-4) unit_vec_to_col by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ = ‚ü®unit_vec n i |unit_vec n j‚ü©"
    using assms(1-2) inner_prod_with_unitary_mat index_unit_vec(3) by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    using assms(3-5) by simp
qed

lemma orthogonal_row_of_unitary [simp]:
  fixes U::"complex mat"
  assumes "unitary U" and "dim_row U = n" and "i < n" and "j < n" and "i ‚â† j"
  shows "‚ü®row U i|row U j‚ü© = 0"
  using assms orthogonal_col_of_unitary transpose_of_unitary_is_unitary col_transpose
  by (metis index_transpose_mat(3))


text‚Äπ
As a consequence, we prove that a quantum gate acting on a state of a system of n qubits give 
another state of that same system.
‚Ä∫

lemma gate_on_state_is_state [intro, simp]:
  assumes a1:"gate n A" and a2:"state n v"
  shows "state n (A * v)"
proof
  show "dim_row (A * v) = 2^n"
    using gate_def state_def a1 by simp
next
  show "dim_col (A * v) = 1"
    using state_def a2 by simp
next
  have "square_mat A"
    using a1 gate_def by simp
  then have "dim_col A = 2^n"
    using a1 gate.dim_row by simp
  then have "dim_col A = dim_row v"
    using a2 state.dim_row by simp
  then have "‚à•col (A * v) 0‚à• = ‚à•col v 0‚à•"
    using unitary_is_length_preserving_bis assms gate_def state_def by simp
  thus"‚à•col (A * v) 0‚à• = 1"
    using a2 state.is_normal by simp
qed


subsection ‚ÄπA Few Well-known Quantum Gates‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
Any unitary operation on n qubits can be implemented exactly by composing single qubits and
CNOT-gates (controlled-NOT gates). However, no straightforward method is known to implement these 
gates in a fashion which is resistant to errors. But, the Hadamard gate, the phase gate, the 
CNOT-gate and the @{text "œÄ/8"} gate are also universal for quantum computations, i.e. any quantum circuit on 
n qubits can be approximated to an arbitrary accuracy by using only these gates, and these gates can 
be implemented in a fault-tolerant way. 
‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπWe introduce a coercion from real matrices to complex matrices.‚Ä∫

definition real_to_cpx_mat:: "real mat ‚áí complex mat" where
"real_to_cpx_mat A ‚â° mat (dim_row A) (dim_col A) (Œª(i,j). A $$ (i,j))"

text ‚ÄπOur first quantum gate: the identity matrix! Arguably, not a very interesting one though!‚Ä∫

definition Id :: "nat ‚áí complex mat" where
"Id n ‚â° 1‚á©m (2^n)"

lemma id_is_gate [simp]:
  "gate n (Id n)"
proof
  show "dim_row (Id n) = 2^n"
    using Id_def by simp
next
  show "square_mat (Id n)"
    using Id_def by simp
next
  show "unitary (Id n)" 
    by (simp add: Id_def)
qed

text ‚ÄπMore interesting: the Pauli matrices.‚Ä∫

definition X ::"complex mat" where
"X ‚â° mat 2 2 (Œª(i,j). if i=j then 0 else 1)"

text‚Äπ 
Be aware that @{text "gate n A"} means that the matrix A has dimension @{text "2^n * 2^n"}. 
For instance, with this convention a 2 X 2 matrix A which is unitary satisfies @{text "gate 1 A"}
 but not @{text "gate 2 A"} as one might have been expected.
‚Ä∫

lemma dagger_of_X [simp]:
  "X‚áß‚Ä† = X"
  using dagger_def by (simp add: X_def cong_mat)

lemma X_inv [simp]:
  "X * X = 1‚á©m 2"
  apply(simp add: X_def times_mat_def one_mat_def)
  apply(rule cong_mat)
  by(auto simp: scalar_prod_def)

lemma X_is_gate [simp]:
  "gate 1 X"
  by (simp add: gate_def unitary_def)
    (simp add: X_def)

definition Y ::"complex mat" where
"Y ‚â° mat 2 2 (Œª(i,j). if i=j then 0 else (if i=0 then -ùóÇ else ùóÇ))"

lemma dagger_of_Y [simp]:
  "Y‚áß‚Ä† = Y"
  using dagger_def by (simp add: Y_def cong_mat)

lemma Y_inv [simp]:
  "Y * Y = 1‚á©m 2"
  apply(simp add: Y_def times_mat_def one_mat_def)
  apply(rule cong_mat)
  by(auto simp: scalar_prod_def)

lemma Y_is_gate [simp]:
  "gate 1 Y"
  by (simp add: gate_def unitary_def)
    (simp add: Y_def)

definition Z ::"complex mat" where
"Z ‚â° mat 2 2 (Œª(i,j). if i‚â†j then 0 else (if i=0 then 1 else -1))"

lemma dagger_of_Z [simp]:
  "Z‚áß‚Ä† = Z"
  using dagger_def by (simp add: Z_def cong_mat)

lemma Z_inv [simp]:
  "Z * Z = 1‚á©m 2"
  apply(simp add: Z_def times_mat_def one_mat_def)
  apply(rule cong_mat)
  by(auto simp: scalar_prod_def)

lemma Z_is_gate [simp]:
  "gate 1 Z"
  by (simp add: gate_def unitary_def)
    (simp add: Z_def)

text ‚ÄπThe Hadamard gate‚Ä∫

definition H ::"complex mat" where
"H ‚â° 1/sqrt(2) ‚ãÖ‚á©m (mat 2 2 (Œª(i,j). if i‚â†j then 1 else (if i=0 then 1 else -1)))"

lemma H_without_scalar_prod:
  "H = mat 2 2 (Œª(i,j). if i‚â†j then 1/sqrt(2) else (if i=0 then 1/sqrt(2) else -(1/sqrt(2))))"
  using cong_mat by (auto simp: H_def)

lemma dagger_of_H [simp]:
  "H‚áß‚Ä† = H"
  using dagger_def by (auto simp: H_def cong_mat)

lemma H_inv [simp]:
  "H * H = 1‚á©m 2"
  apply(simp add: H_def times_mat_def one_mat_def)
  apply(rule cong_mat)
  by(auto simp: scalar_prod_def complex_eqI)

lemma H_is_gate [simp]:
  "gate 1 H"
  by (simp add: gate_def unitary_def)
    (simp add: H_def)

lemma H_values:
  fixes i j:: nat
  assumes "i < dim_row H" and "j < dim_col H" and "i ‚â† 1 ‚à® j ‚â† 1" 
  shows "H $$ (i,j) = 1/sqrt 2"
proof-
  have "i < 2"
    using assms(1) by (simp add: H_without_scalar_prod less_2_cases)
  moreover have "j < 2"
    using assms(2) by (simp add: H_without_scalar_prod less_2_cases)
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    using assms(3) H_without_scalar_prod by(smt One_nat_def index_mat(1) less_2_cases old.prod.case)
qed

lemma H_values_right_bottom:
  fixes i j:: nat
  assumes "i = 1 ‚àß j = 1"
  shows "H $$ (i,j) = - 1/sqrt 2"     
  using assms by (simp add: H_without_scalar_prod)

text ‚ÄπThe controlled-NOT gate‚Ä∫

definition CNOT ::"complex mat" where
"CNOT ‚â° mat 4 4 
  (Œª(i,j). if i=0 ‚àß j=0 then 1 else 
    (if i=1 ‚àß j=1 then 1 else 
      (if i=2 ‚àß j=3 then 1 else 
        (if i=3 ‚àß j=2 then 1 else 0))))"

lemma dagger_of_CNOT [simp]:
  "CNOT‚áß‚Ä† = CNOT"
  using dagger_def by (simp add: CNOT_def cong_mat)

lemma CNOT_inv [simp]:
  "CNOT * CNOT = 1‚á©m 4"
  apply(simp add: CNOT_def times_mat_def one_mat_def)
  apply(rule cong_mat)
  by(auto simp: scalar_prod_def)

lemma CNOT_is_gate [simp]:
  "gate 2 CNOT"
  by (simp add: gate_def unitary_def)
    (simp add: CNOT_def)

text ‚ÄπThe phase gate, also known as the S-gate‚Ä∫

definition S ::"complex mat" where
"S ‚â° mat 2 2 (Œª(i,j). if i=0 ‚àß j=0 then 1 else (if i=1 ‚àß j=1 then ùóÇ else 0))"

text ‚ÄπThe @{text "œÄ/8"} gate, also known as the T-gate‚Ä∫

definition T ::"complex mat" where
"T ‚â° mat 2 2 (Œª(i,j). if i=0 ‚àß j=0 then 1 else (if i=1 ‚àß j=1 then exp(ùóÇ*(pi/4)) else 0))"

text ‚ÄπA few relations between the Hadamard gate and the Pauli matrices‚Ä∫

lemma HXH_is_Z [simp]:
  "H * X * H = Z" 
  apply(simp add: X_def Z_def H_def times_mat_def)
  apply(rule cong_mat)
  by(auto simp add: scalar_prod_def complex_eqI)

lemma HYH_is_minusY [simp]:
  "H * Y * H = - Y" 
  apply(simp add: Y_def H_def times_mat_def)
  apply(rule eq_matI)
  by(auto simp add: scalar_prod_def complex_eqI)

lemma HZH_is_X [simp]:
  shows "H * Z * H = X"  
  apply(simp add: X_def Z_def H_def times_mat_def)
  apply(rule cong_mat)
  by(auto simp add: scalar_prod_def complex_eqI)


subsection ‚ÄπThe Bell States‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
We introduce below the so-called Bell states, also known as EPR pairs (EPR stands for Einstein,
Podolsky and Rosen).
‚Ä∫

definition bell00 ::"complex mat" ("|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©0‚ü©") where
"bell00 ‚â° 1/sqrt(2) ‚ãÖ‚á©m |vec 4 (Œªi. if i=0 ‚à® i=3 then 1 else 0)‚ü©"

definition bell01 ::"complex mat" ("|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©1‚ü©") where
"bell01 ‚â° 1/sqrt(2) ‚ãÖ‚á©m |vec 4 (Œªi. if i=1 ‚à® i=2 then 1 else 0)‚ü©"

definition bell10 ::"complex mat" ("|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©0‚ü©") where
"bell10 ‚â° 1/sqrt(2) ‚ãÖ‚á©m |vec 4 (Œªi. if i=0 then 1 else if i=3 then -1 else 0)‚ü©"

definition bell11 ::"complex mat" ("|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©1‚ü©") where
"bell11 ‚â° 1/sqrt(2) ‚ãÖ‚á©m |vec 4 (Œªi. if i=1 then 1 else if i=2 then -1 else 0)‚ü©"

lemma
  shows bell00_is_state [simp]:"state 2 |Œ≤‚á©0‚á©0‚ü©" and bell01_is_state [simp]:"state 2 |Œ≤‚á©0‚á©1‚ü©" and 
    bell10_is_state [simp]:"state 2 |Œ≤‚á©1‚á©0‚ü©" and bell11_is_state [simp]:"state 2 |Œ≤‚á©1‚á©1‚ü©"
  by (auto simp: state_def bell00_def bell01_def bell10_def bell11_def ket_vec_def)
    (auto simp: cpx_vec_length_def Set_Interval.lessThan_atLeast0 cmod_def power2_eq_square) 

lemma bell00_index [simp]:
  shows "|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©0‚ü© $$ (0,0) = 1/sqrt 2" and "|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©0‚ü© $$ (1,0) = 0" and "|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©0‚ü© $$ (2,0) = 0" and 
    "|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©0‚ü© $$ (3,0) = 1/sqrt 2"
  by (auto simp: bell00_def ket_vec_def)

lemma bell01_index [simp]:
  shows "|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©1‚ü© $$ (0,0) = 0" and "|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©1‚ü© $$ (1,0) = 1/sqrt 2" and "|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©1‚ü© $$ (2,0) = 1/sqrt 2" and 
    "|Œ≤‚á©0‚á©1‚ü© $$ (3,0) = 0"
  by (auto simp: bell01_def ket_vec_def)

lemma bell10_index [simp]:
  shows "|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©0‚ü© $$ (0,0) = 1/sqrt 2" and "|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©0‚ü© $$ (1,0) = 0" and "|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©0‚ü© $$ (2,0) = 0" and 
    "|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©0‚ü© $$ (3,0) = - 1/sqrt 2"
  by (auto simp: bell10_def ket_vec_def)

lemma bell_11_index [simp]:
  shows "|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©1‚ü© $$ (0,0) = 0" and "|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©1‚ü© $$ (1,0) = 1/sqrt 2" and "|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©1‚ü© $$ (2,0) = - 1/sqrt 2" and 
    "|Œ≤‚á©1‚á©1‚ü© $$ (3,0) = 0"
  by (auto simp: bell11_def ket_vec_def)


subsection ‚ÄπThe Bitwise Inner Product‚Ä∫

definition bitwise_inner_prod:: "nat ‚áí nat ‚áí nat ‚áí nat" where 
"bitwise_inner_prod n i j = (‚àëk‚àà{0..<n}. (bin_rep n i) ! k * (bin_rep n j) ! k)"

abbreviation bip:: "nat ‚áí nat ‚áí nat ‚áí nat" ("_ ‚ãÖ‚áò_‚áô  _") where
"bip i n j ‚â° bitwise_inner_prod n i j"

lemma bitwise_inner_prod_fst_el_0: 
  assumes "i < 2^n ‚à® j < 2^n" 
  shows "(i ‚ãÖ‚áòSuc n‚áô j) = (i mod 2^n) ‚ãÖ‚áòn‚áô (j mod 2^n)" 
proof-
  have "bip i (Suc n) j = (‚àëk‚àà{0..<(Suc n)}. (bin_rep (Suc n) i) ! k * (bin_rep (Suc n) j) ! k)" 
    using bitwise_inner_prod_def by simp
  also have "... = bin_rep (Suc n) i ! 0 * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! 0 + 
             (‚àëk‚àà{1..<(Suc n)}. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! k * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! k)"
    by (simp add: sum.atLeast_Suc_lessThan)
  also have "... = (‚àëk‚àà{1..<(Suc n)}. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! k * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! k)"
    using bin_rep_index_0[of i n] bin_rep_index_0[of j n] assms by auto
  also have "... = (‚àëk‚àà{0..<n}. bin_rep (Suc n) i !(k+1) * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! (k+1))" 
     using sum.shift_bounds_Suc_ivl[of "Œªk. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! k * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! k" "0" "n"] 
     by (metis (no_types, lifting) One_nat_def add.commute plus_1_eq_Suc sum.cong)
  finally have "bip i (Suc n) j = (‚àëk‚àà{0..<n}. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! (k+1) * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! (k+1))" 
    by simp
  moreover have "k‚àà{0..n} ‚ü∂ bin_rep (Suc n) i ! (k+1) = bin_rep n (i mod 2^n) ! k" for k
    using bin_rep_def by (simp add: bin_rep_aux_neq_nil)
  moreover have "k‚àà{0..n} ‚ü∂ bin_rep (Suc n) j !(k+1) = bin_rep n (j mod 2^n) ! k" for k 
    using bin_rep_def by (simp add: bin_rep_aux_neq_nil)
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using assms bin_rep_index_0 bitwise_inner_prod_def by simp
qed

lemma bitwise_inner_prod_fst_el_is_1:
  fixes n i j:: nat
  assumes "i ‚â• 2^n ‚àß j ‚â• 2^n" and "i < 2^(n+1) ‚àß j < 2^(n+1)"
  shows "(i ‚ãÖ‚áò(n+1)‚áô j) = 1 + ((i mod 2^n) ‚ãÖ‚áòn‚áô (j mod 2^n))" 
proof-
  have "bip i (Suc n) j = (‚àëk‚àà{0..<(Suc n)}. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! k * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! k)" 
    using bitwise_inner_prod_def by simp
  also have "... = bin_rep (Suc n) i ! 0 * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! 0 + 
            (‚àëk‚àà{1..<(Suc n)}. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! k * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! k)"
    by (simp add: sum.atLeast_Suc_lessThan)
  also have "... = 1 + (‚àëk‚àà{1..<(Suc n)}. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! k * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! k)"
    using bin_rep_index_0_geq[of n i] bin_rep_index_0_geq[of n j] assms by simp
  also have "... = 1 + (‚àëk ‚àà {0..<n}. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! (k+1) * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! (k+1))" 
    using sum.shift_bounds_Suc_ivl[of "Œªk. (bin_rep (Suc n) i)!k * (bin_rep (Suc n) j)!k" "0" "n"] 
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) One_nat_def Suc_eq_plus1 sum.cong)
  finally have f0:"bip i (Suc n) j = 1 + (‚àëk‚àà{0..<n}. bin_rep (Suc n) i ! (k+1) * bin_rep (Suc n) j ! (k+1))"
    by simp
  moreover have "k‚àà{0..n} ‚ü∂ bin_rep (Suc n) i ! (k+1) = bin_rep n (i mod 2^n) ! k
‚àß bin_rep (Suc n) j ! (k+1) = bin_rep n (j mod 2^n) ! k" for k
    using bin_rep_def by(metis Suc_eq_plus1 bin_rep_aux.simps(2) bin_rep_aux_neq_nil butlast.simps(2) nth_Cons_Suc)
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using bitwise_inner_prod_def by simp
qed

lemma bitwise_inner_prod_with_zero:
  assumes "m < 2^n"
  shows "(0 ‚ãÖ‚áòn‚áô  m) = 0" 
proof-
  have "(0 ‚ãÖ‚áòn‚áô  m) = (‚àëj‚àà{0..<n}. bin_rep n 0 ! j * bin_rep n m ! j)" 
    using bitwise_inner_prod_def by simp
  moreover have "(‚àëj‚àà{0..<n}. bin_rep n 0 ! j * bin_rep n m ! j) 
               = (‚àëj‚àà{0..<n}. 0 * (bin_rep n m) ! j)"
    by (simp add: bin_rep_index)
  ultimately show "?thesis" 
    by simp
qed

(*
Biblio:

@book{MikeandIke,
  author = {Nielsen, Michael A. and Chuang, Isaac L.},
  publisher = {Cambridge University Press},
  title = {Quantum Computation and Quantum Information},
  year = 2010
}
*)
end

Theory Complex_Vectors

(* Author: Anthony Bordg, University of Cambridge, apdb3@cam.ac.uk *)

section ‚ÄπComplex Vectors‚Ä∫

theory Complex_Vectors
imports 
  Quantum
  VectorSpace.VectorSpace
begin


subsection ‚ÄπThe Vector Space of Complex Vectors of Dimension n‚Ä∫

definition module_cpx_vec:: "nat ‚áí (complex, complex vec) module" where
"module_cpx_vec n ‚â° module_vec TYPE(complex) n"

definition cpx_rng:: "complex ring" where
"cpx_rng ‚â° ‚¶ácarrier = UNIV, mult = (*), one = 1, zero = 0, add = (+)‚¶à"

lemma cpx_cring_is_field [simp]:
  "field cpx_rng"
  apply unfold_locales
                   apply (auto intro: right_inverse simp: cpx_rng_def Units_def field_simps)
  by (metis add.right_neutral add_diff_cancel_left' add_uminus_conv_diff)

lemma cpx_abelian_monoid [simp]:
  "abelian_monoid cpx_rng"
  using cpx_cring_is_field
  by (simp add: field_def abelian_group_def cring_def domain_def ring_def)

lemma vecspace_cpx_vec [simp]:
  "vectorspace cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n)"
  apply unfold_locales
                      apply (auto simp: cpx_rng_def module_cpx_vec_def module_vec_def Units_def field_simps)
    apply (auto intro: right_inverse add_inv_exists_vec)
  by (metis add.right_neutral add_diff_cancel_left' add_uminus_conv_diff)

lemma module_cpx_vec [simp]:
  "Module.module cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n)"
  using vecspace_cpx_vec by (simp add: vectorspace_def)

definition state_basis:: "nat ‚áí nat ‚áí complex vec" where
"state_basis n i ‚â° unit_vec (2^n) i"

definition unit_vectors:: "nat ‚áí (complex vec) set" where
"unit_vectors n ‚â° {unit_vec n i | i::nat. 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n}"

lemma unit_vectors_carrier_vec [simp]:
  "unit_vectors n ‚äÜ carrier_vec n"
  using unit_vectors_def by auto

lemma (in Module.module) finsum_over_singleton [simp]:
  assumes "f x ‚àà carrier M"
  shows "finsum M f {x} = f x"
  using assms by simp

lemma lincomb_over_singleton [simp]:
  assumes "x ‚àà carrier_vec n" and "f ‚àà {x} ‚Üí UNIV"
  shows "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f {x} = f x ‚ãÖ‚á©v x" 
  using assms module.lincomb_def module_cpx_vec module_cpx_vec_def module.finsum_over_singleton
  by (smt module_vec_simps(3) module_vec_simps(4) smult_carrier_vec)

lemma dim_vec_lincomb [simp]:
  assumes "finite F" and "f: F ‚Üí UNIV" and "F ‚äÜ carrier_vec n"
  shows "dim_vec (module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f F) = n"
  using assms
proof(induct F)
  case empty
  show "dim_vec (module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f {}) = n"
  proof -
    have "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f {} = 0‚á©v n"
      using module.lincomb_def abelian_monoid.finsum_empty module_cpx_vec_def vecspace_cpx_vec vectorspace_def
      by (smt abelian_group_def Module.module_def module_vec_simps(2))
    thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
next
  case (insert x F)
  hence "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f (insert x F) = 
    (f x ‚ãÖ‚á©v x) ‚äï‚áòmodule_cpx_vec n‚áô module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f F"
    using module_cpx_vec_def module_vec_def module_cpx_vec module.lincomb_insert cpx_rng_def insert_subset
    by (smt Pi_I' UNIV_I Un_insert_right module_vec_simps(4) partial_object.select_convs(1) sup_bot.comm_neutral)
  hence "dim_vec (module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f (insert x F)) = 
    dim_vec (module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f F)"
    using index_add_vec by (simp add: module_cpx_vec_def module_vec_simps(1))
  thus "dim_vec (module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f (insert x F)) = n"
    using insert.hyps(3) insert.prems(2) by simp
qed

lemma lincomb_vec_index [simp]:
  assumes "finite F" and a2:"i < n" and "F ‚äÜ carrier_vec n" and "f: F ‚Üí UNIV"
  shows "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f F $ i = (‚àëv‚ààF. f v * (v $ i))"
  using assms
proof(induct F)
  case empty
  then show "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f {} $ i = (‚àëv‚àà{}. f v * v $ i)"
    apply auto
    using a2 module.lincomb_def abelian_monoid.finsum_empty module_cpx_vec_def
    by (metis (mono_tags) abelian_group_def index_zero_vec(1) module_cpx_vec Module.module_def module_vec_simps(2))
next
  case(insert x F)
  have "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f (insert x F) = 
      f x ‚ãÖ‚á©v x ‚äï‚áòmodule_cpx_vec n‚áô module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f F"
    using module.lincomb_insert module_cpx_vec insert.hyps(1) module_cpx_vec_def module_vec_def
      insert.prems(2) insert.hyps(2) insert.prems(3) insert_def
    by (smt Pi_I' UNIV_I Un_insert_right cpx_rng_def insert_subset module_vec_simps(4) 
        partial_object.select_convs(1) sup_bot.comm_neutral)
  then have "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f (insert x F) $ i = 
      (f x ‚ãÖ‚á©v x) $ i + module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f F $ i"
    using index_add_vec(1) a2 dim_vec_lincomb
    by (metis Pi_split_insert_domain  insert.hyps(1) insert.prems(2) insert.prems(3) insert_subset 
        module_cpx_vec_def module_vec_simps(1))
  hence "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f (insert x F) $ i = f x * x $ i + (‚àëv‚ààF. f v * v $ i)"
    using index_smult_vec a2 insert.prems(2) insert_def insert.hyps(3) by auto
  with insert show "module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) f (insert x F) $ i = (‚àëv‚ààinsert x F. f v * v $ i)"
    by auto
qed

lemma unit_vectors_is_lin_indpt [simp]:
  "module.lin_indpt cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n) (unit_vectors n)"
proof
  assume "module.lin_dep cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n) (unit_vectors n)"
  hence "‚àÉA a v. (finite A ‚àß A ‚äÜ (unit_vectors n) ‚àß (a ‚àà A ‚Üí UNIV) ‚àß 
    (module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) a A = ùü¨‚áòmodule_cpx_vec n‚áô) ‚àß (v ‚àà A) ‚àß (a v ‚â† ùü¨‚áòcpx_rng‚áô))"
    using module.lin_dep_def cpx_rng_def module_cpx_vec by (smt Pi_UNIV UNIV_I)
  moreover obtain A and a and v where f1:"finite A" and f2:"A ‚äÜ (unit_vectors n)" and "a ‚àà A ‚Üí UNIV" 
    and f4:"module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) a A = ùü¨‚áòmodule_cpx_vec n‚áô" and f5:"v ‚àà A" and 
    f6:"a v ‚â† ùü¨‚áòcpx_rng‚áô"
    using calculation by blast
  moreover obtain i where f7:"v = unit_vec n i" and f8:"i < n"
    using unit_vectors_def calculation by auto
  ultimately have f9:"module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) a A $ i = (‚àëu‚ààA. a u * (u $ i))"
    using lincomb_vec_index 
    by (smt carrier_dim_vec index_unit_vec(3) mem_Collect_eq subset_iff sum.cong unit_vectors_def)
  moreover have "‚àÄu‚ààA.‚àÄj<n. u = unit_vec n j ‚ü∂ j ‚â† i ‚ü∂ a u * (u $ i) = 0"
    using unit_vectors_def index_unit_vec by (simp add: f8)
  then have "(‚àëu‚ààA. a u * (u $ i)) = (‚àëu‚ààA. if u=v then a v * v $ i else 0)"
    using f2 unit_vectors_def f7 by (smt mem_Collect_eq subsetCE sum.cong)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = a v * (v $ i)"
    using abelian_monoid.finsum_singleton[of cpx_rng v A "Œªu‚ààA. a u * (u $ i)"] cpx_abelian_monoid
      f5 f1 cpx_rng_def by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ = a v"
    using f7 index_unit_vec f8 by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â† 0"
    using f6 by (simp add: cpx_rng_def)
  finally show False
    using f4 module_cpx_vec_def module_vec_def index_zero_vec f8 f9 by (simp add: module_vec_simps(2))
qed

lemma unit_vectors_is_genset [simp]:
  "module.gen_set cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n) (unit_vectors n)"
proof
  show "module.span cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n) (unit_vectors n) ‚äÜ carrier (module_cpx_vec n)"
    using module.span_def dim_vec_lincomb carrier_vec_def cpx_rng_def
    by (smt Collect_mono index_unit_vec(3) module.span_is_subset2 module_cpx_vec module_cpx_vec_def 
        module_vec_simps(3) unit_vectors_def)
next
  show "carrier (module_cpx_vec n) ‚äÜ module.span cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n) (unit_vectors n)"
  proof
    fix v
    assume a1:"v ‚àà carrier (module_cpx_vec n)"
    define A a lc where "A = {unit_vec n i ::complex vec| i::nat. i < n ‚àß v $ i ‚â† 0}" and 
      "a = (Œªu‚ààA. u ‚àô v)" and "lc = module.lincomb (module_cpx_vec n) a A"
    then have f1:"finite A" by simp
    have f2:"A ‚äÜ carrier_vec n"
      using carrier_vec_def A_def by auto
    have f3:"a ‚àà A ‚Üí UNIV"
      using a_def by simp
    then have f4:"dim_vec v = dim_vec lc"
      using f1 f2 f3 a1 module_cpx_vec_def dim_vec_lincomb lc_def by (simp add: module_vec_simps(3))
    then have f5:"i < n ‚üπ lc $ i = (‚àëu‚ààA. u ‚àô v * u $ i)" for i
      using lincomb_vec_index lc_def a_def f1 f2 f3 by simp
    then have "i < n ‚üπ j < n ‚üπ j ‚â† i ‚üπ unit_vec n j ‚àô v * unit_vec n j $ i = 0" for i j by simp
    then have "i < n ‚üπ lc $ i = (‚àëu‚ààA. if u = unit_vec n i then v $ i else 0)" for i
      using a1 A_def f5 scalar_prod_left_unit
      by (smt f4 carrier_vecI dim_vec_lincomb f1 f2 f3 index_unit_vec(2) lc_def 
          mem_Collect_eq mult.right_neutral sum.cong)
    then have "i < n ‚üπ lc $ i = v $ i" for i
      using abelian_monoid.finsum_singleton[of cpx_rng i] A_def cpx_rng_def by simp
    then have f6:"v = lc"
      using eq_vecI f4 dim_vec_lincomb f1 f2 lc_def by auto
    have "A ‚äÜ unit_vectors n"
      using A_def unit_vectors_def by auto
    thus "v ‚àà module.span cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n) (unit_vectors n)"
      using f6 module.span_def[of cpx_rng "module_cpx_vec n"] lc_def f1 f2 cpx_rng_def module_cpx_vec
      by (smt Pi_I' UNIV_I mem_Collect_eq partial_object.select_convs(1))
  qed
qed
    
lemma unit_vectors_is_basis [simp]:
  "vectorspace.basis cpx_rng (module_cpx_vec n) (unit_vectors n)"
proof -
  fix n
  have "unit_vectors n ‚äÜ carrier (module_cpx_vec n)"
    using unit_vectors_def module_cpx_vec_def module_vec_simps(3) by fastforce
  then show ?thesis
